title: Fun Coloring
text: I am impressed with these. The artwork is good. They are fun to color. It would have been nice to have a bit of suggestion as to what coloring medium is best. I use alcohol ink markers in my artwork, so I tried them first. They do work, but be prepared for major bleed to the back of the paper. Protect your work surface.  Colored pencils were good too. The paper isn't too thick so I wouldn't use something water based unless you have a very light hand. All in all these are fun!

title: Fun!
text: I am impressed with these. The artwork is good. They are fun to color. It would have been nice to have a bit of suggestion as to what coloring medium is best. title: Adorable
text: I know nothing about this movie, but I love soft furry animals. This does not disappoint. Surprisingly it actually works as well.  The head raises and the eyelids go up as he wakes up. The voice activation is clear. Quite a lovely creature for a child or child at heart.

title: Fun Puzzle
text: My Mother does several puzzles a week and she really enjoyed this one. It looked lovely when it was finished. Very fun!

title: Permanently Creased
text: This is the third set of these from various manufacturers. They are all folded to be shipped which culminates in  creases that never go away. I did my first one of these a year ago and you can still see the crease in the middle despite multiple attempts at ironing it out, rolling it, etc. One thing on the plus side with this set is that the adhesive is really tacky unlike some of the others that have pretty crappy sticking power.

title: Don't Bother
text: This is a waste of time and money. The contents barely fill the bottom of the little box. The whole top of the metal container was crushed from being shipped in a padded envelope.  Easily readable instructions which are good, but the beads and the stringing material are just not worth the trouble.

title: Really Cool
text: What's not to like? This little guy moves in many directions.  Not a bad likeness to the actor either. Kids are gonna want these to add to their collections. Very well put together too. No little pieces. Waterproof. Should last unless you play tug of war with it.

title: Slime Coming Up
text: The perfect amount of glue to make a nice batch of slime. Also handy for actually gluing things together. Been using Elmer's glue for 50 years. It rocks!

title: The New Beanie Baby
text: I'm 60, and I think  I'm addicted. Cutest little critter ever. I  wish they would have had this kind of thing when I was a kid. Very soft burrito wrapping. The critter is so tucked in, you can't see any of it until you open the burrito. What a super fun thing for Christmas presents or birthdays. I got a Bearito named Frostito.  I love it..  Comes with a card telling you the varieties available and their spiciness value. Great gift.

title: Quality Stamps For Kids and Big Folks
text: This product is a really nice set of alphabet stamps that are designed for kids. They have a nice large letter that is simple and easy to read. The blocks are kind of chunky so they are easy for little fingers to get ahold of.  They come in a very nice wooden box to keep them together and organized.  Small 4 color stamp pad is included along with a project book that had lots of teaching projects in it. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a nice artsy type thing for your kids.

title: Always Good
text: Buy bunches of these for ATC storage and thy are always good!

title: Summertime Fun!
text: These are fairly well made. A friend recommended that I seal them first with sealer or polyurethane. Tried them out and they roll well. We chose to play Yahtzee type games using only five dice. They are fun and durable and should last for years if card for. Nice carrying bag included. Great fun for summer!

title: Lots of Fun
text: We occasionally have little visitors and I thought this might be nice to have around. It is actually a very fun little item. Put together very well. Nothing is going to come off of it into little hands. The musical sounds are fun and there is a fascinating array of tactile items to pull on and play with. The hardest thing was getting it out of the box. All washable. Great fun  for a baby or a toddler.

title: Great For Nesting Boxes
text: Got these to help my hens get the drift of where to lay their eggs. They are so lifelike I have to be careful I don't collect them as the real thing.

title: Well Designed
text: This is a wonderful item. The caddy is well made, the cups come in and out easily. Bright, cheerful colors and plenty of scissors. Each pair has a place for the child to put their name on. Very cleverly designed. The scissors themselves are wonderfully sharp for cutting. I picked these up for myself for gardening and such. I cut a lot of flower and do a lot of deadheading. All the pointy scissors I have always end up poking me or ruining my pockets. These I can stuff wherever and have plenty of them around for whatever chore comes up.

title: Handy Little Trays
text: We like to do jigsaw puzzles in the winter, but have a limited space to lay out the pieces. These work great for that. They are just a touch too small though and if you are putting a single layer of pieces in there they don't hold a lot especially if the pieces are larger sized.  All in all though in conjunction with the puzzle tray we have that has drawers in it they are a good accompaniment and are useful.

title: Paint By Number Without The Numbers
text: I saw these in the craft store and was curious about them. Managed to score some here at Amazon for a trial. The canvases are fairly heavy paper and very well printed. Depending on your planned end purpose for these I would probably back them with a regular canvas for sturdiness. I don't think this would be a really suitable "toy" for children unless they are gifted or much older than the 8 years recommended on the box. I say that because the "paint" that is included is liquid. There are 5 primary colors  of this liquid paint and a small divided dish to mix the colors in. Unless the parents are mixing this paint, or the child had a great knowledge of art, they are going to mix muddy colors and not be pleased with the results. Some sort of regular dry watercolors that are ready to wet and go would be a much better paint for this kind of kit. I plan to do these with watercolor pencils or Inktense pencils since I am an artist and have those supplies.

title: For Children...Really?
text:
I am skeptical that this is marketed as a toy for children. There is nothing about this that is something I would want a child to play with.

I bought it because I do hot wax art and I have lots of bits of leftover wax that I thought might be fun to mold into a useable block. Dumb idea. This product is somewhat complicated to get together. No child I know could use it without complete parental supervision and help.

I followed the directions and used a couple of the crayons that were included and a scrap of another Crayola crayon on my work table. I ran 3 heating cycles and the wax still wasn't completely melted. The crayon that I added melted at a different rate than the ones included. After about an hour I was left with a semi melted, muddy mess that when poured into the mold didn't even fill it up. At this point I decided to just forget it because I didn't have more time to mess with it.

Poorly conceived idea.

text: These kids are adorable!  They come with everything, the decorations are cute, the wire that makes the fairy fly is clever, and the plants sprouted really quickly.  However, the seed mix has several plants that, when mature, would never fit in the tiny planting areas.  I don't expect them to ever bloom.  Even in a bright window, the sprouts are leggy, weak, and falling over.  However, I'm still giving it five stars because my daughter had so much fun with it and I went into it planning on getting some more suitable plants for it, later. I want one, myself!

title: Fantastic little kit!
text: Bought this for my son, who loves to garden.  He wasn't thrilled about the fairy aspect, but he spruced it up with some Pokemon figures.  The plants sprouted right away and are growing well, but I doubt they will ever bloom.  Even in a bright window, they are weak and leggy and falling over.  Once I read the seed packet ingredients I knew they wouldn't be great plants for the space, so I had planned on getting him better plants later anyway.  I'm still giving it five stars, though, because it was a adorable little kit, with dirt and tools and decorations and seeds, and the wire for the fairy to fly on was really clever.  My son has had a fantastic time taking care of his tiny garden. I got my two daughters different kits from the same company and they loved them, too.  I even want one!

title: Not great
text: They're ok.. honestly they're pretty hard to put together. Even using the suggested “builds”, it was difficult to ensure you had the balls lined up correctly. They are angled just so, and kind of hard to make sure they are pointed the right way. The sticks are pretty difficult to get into the holes, and they come out surprisingly easily considering how hard it was to get them in. The sticks bend easily when trying to put them together. The set isn't “terrible”, but for what I paid for them (I bought two sets, and I would have sent them back, except the children saw them and wanted to play with them) I thought they would have been better quality. With all that being said, the kids do like them. But don't expect a child under the age of probably 9-10 to be able to put them together at all.

It doesn't do anything. It just makes noise, and it's eyes do weird things. The instructions are kind of confusing for the "games". There is no way in the world I would buy this again. In my opinion it's a waste of money, and it's kind of annoying. The "songs" are terrible. We've had it for a couple of weeks now and she hasn't played with it since the first week. I would give it one star, except she does like it (I guess) and the website description was "technically" accurate. Even the little casters on the cats feet are not great. She barely rolls around on them. Battery life is not great either. Honestly, I have no idea how I got duped into buying this expensive noise maker.

The cats do rinse off and they kind of fit in the little felt beds. Their heads are super wobbly and often turn around completely backwards. I would not recommend this product.

title: Another Great Game for Laughs with Friends
text:
If you are a fan of games like Cards Against Humanity you will enjoy this game - and this one is a bit more family friendly and appropriate for mixed groups.

Play is very similar to all of the games like this and like most others we just play until we are done playing without following the directions. We have never seen these games as ones to keep score as playing, though you could.

This is an excellent choice if you are looking for a game to use during family gatherings at the holidays. It's guaranteed to get everyone laughing, interacting and enjoying their time together.

The cards are high quality, the colors vibrant, the box sturdy. This is a set that you will enjoy owning and will return to again and again.

Loads of laughs.

title: Poor Quality Pool Floats - Trash in Under a Month
text:
These products, both the dry float lounger and the socializer are prime examples of why I test products the way I do prior to writing my review.

When I initially received these products and inflated them I was fairly impressed with the design and comfort - by 18 days later both were flat lumps of rubber in the trash.

First the socializer never held air. After inflation by the following morning it had deflated to around 70% capacity. I put it under water in the pool and discovered multiple small defects in 2 seams.

The dry float lounger lasted a bit longer at 18 days but then was found flat due to a separation at the seam.

It is important to note neither of these were ever used by children or in any rough play as when I review products I adhere to strict guidelines - and there are no children in the home.

While the socializer is listed as a dry float it appears the user's calves and feet would be in the water. The lounger pool float is perfect for those who prefer to float completely out of the water. When floating on this no part of the body is submerged in the water.

While 88-90% of the world's population is right handed this manufacturer chose to place the cup holder on the left side and made it too small to hold a standard 12 Oz can for both of these floats. This is simply poor designing.

While these floats come with a small patch kit, these are only helpful when repairing a puncture and absolutely will not hold a torn seam.

While these floats appeared to have promise initially, in well under a month they proved to be poorly designed, and of substandard construction and materials.

I would not recommend either of these products.

title: Safe Poi Accessory - Great Concept, Poor Execution
text:
I got these to use with long exposure photography.

As I first examined them I realized a critical flaw was they are not rechargeable. Why in the world would anything like this be made where it requires changing out CR1632 batteries? That definitely is a clear indication of a lack of forethought in design.

We used this successfully for about a half hour before the string came loose on one of the balls so we continued with the other. After around another hour the bulb broke free from that one.

Due to using this to capture the light for long exposure photography we were not spinning these quickly by any means - I can't imagine them holding up at all if used as intended.

While the concept is excellent the execution is awful.

title: Dino-Awesome Set packed with FUN
text:
I got this set for my 5 year old nephew who absolutely LOVES dinosaurs. While he has about every dinosaur toy I ever find he didn't have this one but he has had so much fun with it!

This set has endless hours of customizable fun. There are 144 track pieces that snap together and pull apart so tracks can be built disassembled and rebuilt. There are 2 bridges, trees, slopes cage pieces and a boulder. Then combining two of what boys love most - cars and dinosaurs!

The 2 cars race around the tracks powered by a AA battery each (not included) and 2 dinosaur figurines.

This really is a fun set that kids 3-8 will enjoy playing with and will have them using their imagination and building skills. This is definitely a product I recommend - it makes a great gift!

title: AWESOME LED LEVITATION WAND!
text:
I have used several similar products and this is by far my favorite.

As with every product like this I found I wanted to customize it a bit after working with it - that is no big deal.

If you prefer a longer string, snip this one and tie another. The manufacturer recommends Polar Multi-Strand Braided Tip-Up line used for fishing with 40 lbs weight resistance - this can easily be found through fishing retailers. The 13” included sting is the perfect length for beginners. This length will allow for great control and keeping the wand relatively close to the performer will help prevent accidents.

The wand itself is incredibly well made with a plethora of color and pattern options. Everything is controlled via a single button which I've found easy and intuitive to understand and use.

This wand is powered by an internal, USB charged battery (USB 2.0 to Micro cable is included). The battery lasts an incredibly long time - the amount of time is dependent on the level of the luminosity selected and the mode (the brighter the light the less time the battery will last). Once the battery is completely drained it will require 5-6 hours to completely recharge.

Counterbalance is achieved by utilizing the 3 stainless steel washers that are included. Due to the wand containing LED lights at the end washers are needed as the open center allows light to pass through. If you feel the three washers extend the cap too far use a slightly larger, or thicker washer. I have tried multiple configurations of the counterbalance weights and this will all depend on personal preference.

A bit of advice - put a couple drops of superglue between the washers to keep them from moving as the wand is spun - this helps with consistent balance and the washers will not clink together.

The reason the cap comes loose is the force of the counterweights pressing against it - gluing them together helps. In addition I added a couple of rubber bands (from my son's braces - so tiny) to the end of the wand with the counterweights. This gives the silicone cap the perfect traction so it never slips free.

I have used this wand at music festivals, drum circles and for photography light painting. It is really a phenomenal product and while there are cheaper ones on the market, you get what you pay for...

An phenomenal thing to know about EmazingLights is their level of customer support. In researching this product I reached out to their technical support team for a bit of additional information and they were helpful in addition to having an excellent website. This product, like all EmazingLights products, comes with a LIFETIME GUARANTEE! I verified that this warranty includes the recharging battery. If it should ever stop holding a charge all you have to do is contact them and they will replace your wand. You simply can not find a better warranty than that on any similar product from any company.

If you are looking for an awesome LED light wand that is easy to learn with, fun to use and will hold up for years of fun - this is the product to buy. EmazingLights not only has developed and made an incredible product but they stand behind it.

I've absolutely loved mine and know several people who have purchased identical models after taking a twirl with my magic wand.

title: AWESOME GAME for the WHOLE FAMILY!
text:
While many games make the claim that they are suitable for the whole family - this one is actually FUN for the whole family!

As most are familiar with the game Jenga, this is essentially played the same way - pull a block from the stack and place it on top. If your block causes the tower to tumble, you lose. The primary difference is the blocks are SUPERSIZED, measuring 7.1”(long) X 2.3”(wide) X 1.4”(tall). The blocks are the perfect size for little hands and kids get the hang of the game quickly and enjoy seeing the tower grow and eventually topple.

While the game's tower begins at around 2' it quickly grows to 4-5'+. The blocks are not only bigger but they are made of high grade pine, sanded smooth - 20 of the blocks are numbered (1-8, some numbers are duplicated while others are not) allowing players to develop a limitless number of custom games. Something we do is let the winner of each game write their name, or a short message on a block - it makes it fun to look back and remember the fun we have had during previews games.

In addition to the blocks this set comes complete with a wooden crate for storage and travel that easily doubles as a stable, flat playing surface when needed. In addition there is a white board with a dry erase marker for listing the rules you've set for the numbered blocks. Due to the 8 block being a one of a kind, we call it the Magic 8 Block and use that as a wild card type block - the person who pulls and places it can name whatever rule they choose.

This is a game reminiscent of games of old - no batteries, nothing electronic, it will last forever, can go anywhere to be played inside or out and is loads of fun for everyone.

This is most definitely a game set I recommend. We have loved it!

title: Bright Green High Quality Balloons!!!
text:
Depending on what you are decorating for these balloons will accentuate all sorts of themes.

Perfect for limes in giant margarita glasses or beer bottles. Perfect to match with Ninja Turtle party themes. Dino parties - BINGO! Alien heads - OUT OF THIS WORLD!

Whether you fill them with helium so they float or simply blow them up they are awesome.

They are a minimum of 12” but we've blown many up beyond that. Simply stretch them a bit prior to inflation...

These are a high quality balloon that you'll be glad to use at your event.

⭐️As with all Drew's Reviews, if I discover something new about this product - good or bad - I will UPDATE my review. I believe in creating detailed, complete reviews because, like you, I depend on them when I am shopping. If you found my review HELPFUL - please click ⬇️ below!⭐️

title: AWESOME GIFT for my AVID GAMER / UNIQUE TOY COLLECTOR SON

title: Not the best game for young kids.
text:
I purchased this game for my nephew who is almost 4 for Christmas.

It's really not a bad game I guess but requires much more dexterity than most kids under 5 would have. You have to place colored marbles into the caterpillars hands as he wiggles and spins. It can be done but it's too difficult for little hands and short attention spans.

The tiny marbles end up EVERYWHERE - quickly being lost under furniture, etc.

title: Steel???  Really???
text:
I remember when Tonka Trucks were really built of steel and were nearly indestructible - not anymore.

I purchased this as a Christmas gift and I will still give it but I believe Tonka listing steel in the name is purposefully misleading.

The yellow cab in front is steel - nothing else. The vast majority of this product is plastic.

I suppose Plastic Tonka Truck doesn't sound nearly as impressive. Yet another sign of the times.

title: Excellent gift.

title: Kids love these fidget toys.
text:
My 9 year old Grandaughter introduced me to these fidget toys. As a retired occupational therapist and one who used similar toys with patients, I can attest that they promote a relaxation response as they encourage repetition, are tacitile thus reducing tactile defensiveness, and allow children to fiddle with an object that feels spongy which at the same time encourages attention. A great idea for all children to have not only children who have learning deficits or attentional issues.
C Stephan

title: Fun for kids!
text: The gloves were presented in a zipped attractive bag. This is great for gift giving.  I gave it to my grandson who is 11 years old.  There were no directions with the gloves but it is pretty easy to figure out how to use.  You press the button on the back side of the glove to light up.  It really looks like a skeleton.  The challenging part is that it takes a longer time to turn the battery off.  Without instructions one has to fiddle with the button.  The gloves also come with 4 extra flat nickel batteries which is great.  My grandson really likes these gloves when bike riding in the early evening.  C Stephan

title: Great though a little upset.
text: This is my second time buying. text: They come apart within minutes of play and will not stay on adult or children fingers. Too bad.

title: Amazing magic bottles
text: My 2yo daughter can't get over these bottles. They're super strong, will last forever. Super happy with this purchase.

title: Our daughter loved her instantly
text:
She squealed when she opened the gift! She loves her so much.
I was nervous about the smell but it's pretty faint in our case, you only smell it when you hold her to your face.
I picked this baby because of her size, complexion, and the exquisite details of her face.
A great toddler's first baby. It was smaller than I expected but also became obvious right away that this was a good thing for us. Our 2yo wears her in a scarf/makeshift sling wherever we go, it wouldn't have been possible with a heavier or bigger baby.
So so so happy with this baby. Will stick with this brand when daughter wants a bigger baby.

title: Great marble run - just kinda flimsy
text: One star off for the thin plastics. Makes any maze you build less sturdy. The whole thing is pretty light and the feet are very small so it can topple easily. Otherwise it's awesome to play with, kids play together with it harmoniously in our house and for a long time- a rare thing! Also i love the sound of the marbles going through the maze.

title: Love this toy
text: Total success with our two year old. Wéve gifted it to other toddlers and same. Coudn't be happier with a purchase. Keeps her busy, is safe and fun. Love walking in to the kitchen to find her weirdo contraptions on the fridge and oven door!

title: Why do their heads come off???!!!
text:
These figurines are cute and all, but why do their heads come off? My daughter pulls them off instantly and then it looks like a Trolls massacre happened. That's the funny part.
The not funny part is choking hazards, and parts that get lost.
Seriously, WHY.
Make a toy that is durable and stays together please.
Or at least clarify the toy comes apart with the strength of a toddler, and what size the separate pieces are.

title: Wasted money.
text: These are made of cardboard! It is not at all clarified in the ad. Bummer. Was expecting a durable/washable toy. Wasted money.

title: Pieces are too small
text: Our daughter likes to play with this toy but the wood pieces are way too small. We can't leave her alone with it as she could easily stuff a block whole in her mouth and then struggle to get it out. Seems like an odd design decision for a baby toy.

title: My child can finally communicate  read full review for details
text:
Just came into a new relationship, We have a child age 3, who can't not pronounce words at all. Most 90% words all sound the same. So the idea hit me to start teaching sign language. So I bought these cards to teach me and him how to talk to one another. There is a learning curve in figuring out the right ways to move hands for newbies. And can be difficult to get a 3 yrnold attention long enough to learn the signs but the cards are great. Money well spent. I'm happy over all with my purchases and hope this can help someone else in same situation.
All we can do at this point is try. What do we have to loose

I have NOT been paid for this review nor any other review so far. (I wish I would though).
This is, as always, just and only my opinion thought my own eyes and felt with my own hands. I take reviews serious, as I rely on them to make my decisions before any and all my purchases. So if you have found my review helpful please vote and let the other Amazonian Browsers get a better judgment of what to expect and how the product works. Thank you for your time and happy buying.

title: Very well made.  Must have pool lounger
text:
Yet another very rare 5 star review.

This float is perfect in every way. Sturdy back rest, thick rubber, well made mesh, theres nothing really to complain about. You have options of attaching the cup floater on either side AND it holds a cell phone perfectly. My wife loves it and wants another.

Downside: it didnt come with any patch repair at all. I am confident (because of thickness) that the reason for no patch is, you wont be needing one. The float is made in a way that it seems would be difficult to punch a hole. But still would make me feel a whole lot better to included a patch considering its 40$ + for the float.

title: Great toys
text: They are easy to wash and they are really light.

title: Good
text: Good for babies from 7 - 12 months.

title: Great gift
text: I bought it for my kid but i ended up playing with it, they are so cute and realistic. There also a lot of each toy food, prevents fights since there is one for everyone.

title: Defective
text: Not sure if it is just the slide i bought, however it is not sturdy the legs are uneven so it moves a lot.

title: Good but small
text: It's pretty sturdy however it is pretty small so i wouldn't recommend it for a big party.

title: Not worth it
text: It lost air since there was a hole in the three different parts.

title: Great toy camera for younger kids 3-5yo
text: I gave this to my 4.5yo daughter as a first camera. She likes to pretend to take pictures with a fake phone so I thought she would enjoy a real camera. She is obsessed with this! It was very easy for her to learn how to use and charge it on her own. This is a great camera to teach kids about photography. The camera quality itself is poor, I attached an image taken off the camera. It reminds me of a cell phone camera from 10-15 years ago. It's fine for younger kids who don't care but if you have an older child I would suggest getting them a cheap mirrorless DSLR or just a recent phone which will give the ability to take better quality photos.

title: Interactive toy for kids
text: My twins love using their walkie talkies to talk to each other around the house. It's a great toy for younger and older kids alike! These are easy to use, rechargeable and cute colors. The strap that came with broke after a few days of heavy use but I was able to make my own to replace it. The voice quality is good and the sound can be very loud on these walkie talkies.

title: Cute Barbie set
text: This Barbie looks just as pictured. She's a pediatrician and has a lot of little accessories. This set comes with a toddler, my daughter has a fun time playing 'doctor' with this set!

title: Great Barbie set
text: My daughter loves this set since the doll looks just like her! This set comes with a toddler and a pool as well. Lots of fun and a perfect addition to her dollhouse.

title: Well made Mancala set
text: This Mancala board is very well made. The wood is smooth and won't give you splinters! The glass stones are beautiful. My kids love playing this game and I love teaching them games that I used to play at their age! It is well made and would be a good gift to a friend!

title: Great for gifting
text: This card game is really easy to learn. I played with six people and we all were able to understand how to play in just a few mins. Two people pick a number and the leader reads those two facts. Everyone then has to guess which one came 'before' or 'after' the other fact. It was fun and we learned a lot. Game gets kind of stale after a few rounds but it's easy to pick up and start again! This would be a great game for gifting.

title: Great quality wooden set
text: This train set is large enough for two kids to play with at the same time. The kids love the magnets on the train and the crane that winds to pull stuff up and down. The set is made of wood and seems high quality. Some of the wood track was a different color than the rest of the track so if aesthetics is important to you maybe check a different set.

title: Great for pretend play
text: This is a great set to give your kids. I like that it's all pretend makeup and not real, my kids have so many “makeup” sets for little girls with real makeup in it and they absolutely make a mess. This set keeps everything tidy by not having real product. This is perfect for imaginary play, my twin daughters love to give each other makeovers using it.

title: Great for couples and groups
text: This is a fun "get to know you" game for couples and friends. I actually used it at a dinner party with a bunch of couples and we had a blast learning more about each other. The questions are very interesting and not questions you normally see! Great game, portable box. Nothing not to love about it!

title: I think it's lovely
text: This is an extremely detailed doll. The clothing is beautiful, many layers of fabric that makes Chang'e look ethereal. It comes with a jade rabbit and a pink sash. Her hair piece is plastic connected to actual hair. This is a very nice doll that I hesitate giving to my kids even though they love Over The Moon on Netflix. This would be better for older children 6+ in order to keep it in nice condition! She looks very similar to the Chang'e in the animation and the face pace painting is wonderful. I'm really happy to have an Chinese doll in our collection for my kids.

title: Great gift for small children
text: This is a super cute gift for toddlers and younger children. The set comes with both a book and a toy train that relates to the character in the book. I got the Nia one for my daughters and they love it!

title: Great activity for the kids
text: My four year olds had so much fun making these flowers. I know it says 6+ on the packaging but they did fine with supervision! I really like how the dies can be used to cut flowers out of any paper so when you get through the paper that comes with the set, you can use any paper with it. The end result is super cute!

title: Great entertainment for younger children and toddlers
text: This is a cute present to keep my three year old's entertained. They love mimicking my stuff so this is really cute. they use the phone to take 'pictures' of each other and fight over the car keys. It is good for this age range but five and up would probably get bored with it. The watch lights up but my daughter complains that it's uncomfortable to wear (the block on it is huge and pushes into the wrist).

title: Great Hot Wheels track
text: This is a huge hot wheels tower. It is a great set. There's a vertical garage up the side that you can store all of your hot wheels cars in. This is the largest hot wheel set I've ordered for my kids and they LOVE it. At the beginning of the track the cars even go into the air!

title: Smaller marbles than you would expect
text: This marble set was much smaller than I expected. Look at the marbles in my picture compared to my hand. They are definitely not standard sized. My kids still had fun with this set and it comes with the instructions for building the picture they have on the box. I was also weirded out by the box saying 'more pleasure' on it for a kids toy - probably just a strange translation. It is a good set for the prices and younger kids will definitely enjoy using it.

title: So much fun to play with
text: This backpack is insane. It opens up to a huge Pokemon playground that anyone with Pokemon figures would have fun in. There's tons of interactive and moving parts to this behemoth. I'm extremely impressed with this backpack and my kids love playing with it. It comes with only one figure - a pikachu so it would be good to buy some extra Pokemon figures to go with it. There is no assembly required and it opens right away and ready to play. This set is super cute and would make a child or extreme fan's day to receive it as a gift.

title: Great for kids toys, meh as a collectible
text: These are great figures for my kids who love Pokemon. They withstand a lot of play. They aren't extremely stiff and thinner plastic areas like the fins are flexible. There are visible seams in these figures. The biggest issue I have is with the scale. I don't understand why the magikarp is so much larger than the rest of the figures. These remind me of the Pokemon toys that used to come with the McDonald's kids meals when I was a kid. The figures are all really cute and I like that they are from the original cards. It's a great gift for a Pokemon lover in your life.

title: gorgeous play set
text: Famous Schleich quality that you know and love, this is a well made set that children will love for years and you'll be able to pass on in the future. The quality of the horses is amazing, their bodies aren't smooth but look like they have hair everywhere. There is a lot to assemble in this set and many different parts which doesn't make it a good set for younger children. I agree with the age rating on the box that it shouldn't be given to children under 5.  My daughters love this set and play with it for hours at a time!

title: Fun castle for toddlers
text: This is a cute playset for my toddler daughters. I like that two princesses are included so they each have one to play with. The castle itself seems sturdy and has a lot of activities on it. There is no assembly required so all you have to do is unwrap and play! There is a stable part to the castle but no horses included, you have to purchase that separately. My kids have fun with this set and I think it would make a great gift for anyone in the 2-4 age range.

title: Very cute end result
text: End result was really beautiful. The instructions were a nightmare to follow, even for an adult. There are no words and the folding gets really strange. I had to watch a youtube tutorial to finish the cat and it took me about 1.5 hours.  I was going to put it in my daughter's room as a nightlight but since I had to do all the work and it took my so long, it's staying in my office and is mine now! I love that the fairy lights inside are red, they diffuse really well with the purple and pink plastic pieces.

title: Good price for the fun
text: Cute polly pocket set. My 4 year old daughter is obsessed with Polly Pocket and I love these sets that fold up and can be carried around. She puts the wrist wrap around her wrist and takes it everywhere with her. I think the stickers are really coo, the little polly pocket people can stand on them and they will stick to the stickers but they dont really fit in the set well. I'm confused where to put them. Overall my daughter loves this set and it's a good price for a toy.

title: Does not hold up, confusing toy design while charging.
text:
This hatchimal is huge! The crystal home for her is much larger than I expected. It looks really pretty in the crystal container.

When I opened it up 4 of us had a hard time reading the instructions and figuring out how to plug her in to start charging (the charge port is located on her skirt...not the base of the crystal structure). I don't like that she has a stand on the base of the crystal for charging but you can't put the lid on at the same time or it cuts the charge cord. Would have been a nice design detail if there was a hole at the bottom of the top part of the crystal that would fit the cable so I dont have this extra part of the toy sitting around.

There is an on/off switch on her skirt. Once she is turned on you hold her in your hand and she is supposed to start flying. I have issues getting her to start sometimes and have to move my hand underneath the skirt a few times for her to recognize it and start flying. I don't recommend her for indoor use, seems much better and can get a lot more fly time outside in a park than indoors where she will quickly hit a wall or furniture and stop flying. After I pick her up, she will not fly for me again without turning her on and off again. It does hurt to stop her in the air by using your hands. One time this flew into my daughters head and caused a bruise, the wings are hard and hurt more than you would expect.

The next day we tried to use her again but the little bars around her skirt now hit her arms for some reason and stop flying. Nothing happened to her in between us using her the day before. I would have been frustrated if I purchased this toy for $30 to only get one day of use out of it.

Overall my daughter loves this toy and her crystal house and had a lot of fun on the first day of play, the second day of play she was really sad and frustrated that she couldn't get her to fly properly again. Honestly, the coolest thing about this toy is the packaging, My children played for them for maybe two days before losing interest.

title: Fun clue game for the Sabrina fan
text: We really enjoyed playing this reskin of clue. On the dice there's a magnifying glass option which allows you to use clue cards which I don't always see in all versions of clue. The reskin was well done with a lot of the important locations from the show and characters included. It's great fun for a family game night or with friends!

title: Cute
text: This is super cute. My kids love finding coins around the house to put in this piggy bank. It makes noise when the cat comes out, im not sure what it says. This box is much larger than I expected it would be an good quality. Doesn't not come with the 2AA batteries required so make sure to have some on hand.

title: Can't go wrong with a polly pocket set
text: My 3 year old is obsessed with this Polly Pocket set. She got it as a prize for 'finishing' potty training. This set is really neat because there are stickers you can attach to the plastic that the mini dolls actually stick to, its magical. Lots of little pieces but my 3 year old keeps them all together so far. she loves this set and brings it with her everywhere (even to bed). It's super cute.

title: flimsy but works great for what I wanted
text:
This pop up castle is cute and perfect for my twin daughters. They can both fit inside comfortably.

It does feel flimsy after being set up all the way. If my daughter walks through one of the curtains it almost looks like it might fall over. I put this in my kid's room with some pillows inside and they love to go in there and draw pictures. It's a good pop up castle for the price, extremely easy to assemble and the kids have a blast in it. It would be good for birthday parties or just playing around. I'm not expecting it to last a long time with how rough my kids are together but I think they will enjoy it while it lasts!

title: Very Detailed Figures
text: I'm surprised with the size and detail of these tigers. They are beautiful and my daughters love to play with them. They never touch their dolls and just want to play with the tigers! My kids take them outside, in baths and all over the house. These tiger figures are very durable, well painted and will be played with for years to come! I included a picture of the adult tiger in my hand to get an idea of the size of the figures in this lovely set.

title: Cute little tattoo kit
text: Great results. I was a little confused with the instructions. I thought the tattoo glue was for both the paint and the glitter. I think you use one brush for the paint, wet the brush then mix the paint. The other brush is to be used dry for glitter, for glitter you paint the glue where you want it then kind of tap the glitter onto it with the brush. We have great results. I use these as potty training rewards, my kids get a tattoo if they use the bathroom properly! They love these tattoos but the glitter part does get itchy after about an hour and we wash it off.

title: Cute Set
text: This is such a cute set for little kids. I have twin 3.5 yo girls and they play with this every day. It's perfect for multiple kids because you can set it up at a table and put one kid on each side since there's lot to do inside the castle and outside. This comes with an amazing amount of accessories. My daughter loves to make 'tea parties' and the other one is obsessed with the 'treasure chest'. Great set especially if your kids love My Little Pony like mine do!

title: Large castle
text:
Update:
Changing my review from 5 to 3 stars due to the brittleness of the plastic poles. After two nights of having it set up, my small cat jumped on the roof of it and snapped one pole that we used duct tape to fix. The next day one of the kids fell over in it and snapped one of the poles and bent three more. She's only 29 pounds and it really took nothing to break the poles. They were very upset because we had to end up throwing this out since we could not fix it and they really loved it.

This is very easy to assemble, took about 7 mins. It comes in a storage bag, there are plastic poles that hold this castle up from the inside you have to put together. Easily fits my two daughters, I think it could fit three kids if needed. Great for play and dress up! We set this up as soon as it arrived and my kids went crazy. They loved it.

Negative is that the teeth of the velcro are sewn to the inside of the roof so when you pull the roof hole open, the velcro left on the roof gets stuck to my kid's hair and pulls it.

title: Works Great
text: This is a large LCD Writing tablet that is good for at-home use. It comes with the tablet, a stylus (hides away in a slot on the back of the tablet), and a charging cable. It arrives pre-charged so you can use it straight away. The tablet is pressure sensitive. I like the moon and star buttons on the top left of the tablet. The star erases the tablet and the moon locks it so it can't erase. The tip of the stylus was a little jagged and ended up making a permanent small scratch on the screen when I gave it to my 3.5 year old daughter. She loves this table and it was easy for her to understand how to use it. Now she doesn't ask to use my iPad to draw anymore!

title: Missing a few pieces but great play set
text: Shipping was faster than expected and the kids love playing on this. All of my friends have asked where I bought it so they can also buy for their kids. Unfortunately The box was missing a few pieces in it, two black connectors and a long tube. I can't finish building the design in the catalogue that came with it.

title: Beautiful cards
text: I was looking for some fun cards for my friends and I to play card games with and really wanted ones with foil on them. These are beautiful and look terrific. When playing in low light it is really hard to see the green color on the dark cards vs. the light cards but I dont mind so much since they're rainbow foil. The cards are a little harder than normal to shuffle. They are a bit slippery. Overall I LOVE them and will probably buy a second pack in the future.

title: Ragged box, cute doll
text: My granddaughter loves the doll! I couldn't wait to gift the doll so I just gave it to her! I think it's a bit pricey and I wouldn't pay so much for a doll again.  She came in fantastic shape, no marks on the body her clothes were perfect. The box was a bit ragged which didn't affect the doll for the price I would of expected a brand new looking box.

title: Easy to use
text: I bought this for my 8year old granddaughter, she had fun doing it, with a little help from grandma. It reminds me of the ones I had when I was young it came quickly and everything was included.

title: Secret codes and compartments
text: This is a fun toy but if you are getting it for a younger child, adult help is going to be useful. It comes with a code sheet and you have to try the different codes to get the compartments open. It doesn't tell you which codes work for which compartment so you just have to try them all to find the right ones. It has a small  “magnifying” glass to see the codes. The magnifying glass and the code sheet are small don't lose them! It takes a little time to get them all open but it prolongs the excitement of seeing what's next. We really have fun with it.

title: Super adorable
text: My 2 year old son wanted to be a “rainbow bird” for Halloween and this is the first thing we found. It was perfect. When he ran around the “feathers” flew out behind him.

title: The colors are bright and good quality. Everyone loved
text: I used these as the guest book for my sisters bridal shower and had guests sign them with a sharpie.  The colors are bright and good quality. Everyone loved it

title: Soft & Cuddley
text: This is a medium size stuffy.  Looks just like the picture.  Good quality and my 5 year old loves him. ♡

title: Mermaid Shine
text: My daughter still loves this doll, takes it everywhere with her.

title: Rock On
text: My 3 yr old daughter loved it!! She plays it all the time,  acts like she is on a cellphone having conversations with her grandmother lol.

title: Little Toolman
text: It was a birthday gift for my daughter's nephew.  He loves it very much just turned 2 yrs old.

title: ABC's
text: I love the letters my 2 yr old is really starting to understand her alphabet.

title: Great company to purchase from!
text: Cool, enjoyable, fun kit! Lots of balloons come with the kit and the directions are great. My 9 year old makes the sculptures. Customer service from this company is also unbelievably good! Very prompt, thorough and kind.

title: Beautiful Costume!
text: Beautiful costume, well made, soft seams, nothing scratchy.  I would definitely recommend this costume.  The price is right too.  I wish the sizes were a bit bigger though or came in at least one larger size.

title: Fun set, great family project for the Christmas break!
text: Very fun project! My kids enjoyed working on it, and checking the growing crystals each day. Three of the crystals were not very successful, which was a shame because my kids did two each, so that left some of them disappointed. There was a lot of "crystal climbing", and two of them dried out before nice crystals could form. The crystals with red seemed to be the most successful, and the ones with just blue or white failed or were very small. Over all we were pleased and maybe we will get another set and try again.

title: Still works great after a year of use
text: Cute bath toy. One of my kids favorites. Still works great after a year of use.

title: Five Stars
text: Item arrived on time and just as described.

title: Five Stars
text: Item arrived on time and just as described.

title: Five Stars
text: Item arrived on time and just as described.

title: My kids love them!
text: Very cute. My kids love them!

title: Nice target set
text: Nice target set. I bought it as a gift. It arrived right on time and just as described. It only comes in a clear plastic bag (no descriptive labels), so it may need a little dressing up if you plan to give as a gift.

title: Great little Broom
text: Great little broom! I bought it because I needed a short broom to sweep out our hen house, this was almost too nice!

title: Great Nerf Gun
text: Great little Nerf gun! Its easier to fire and my 5 yr old can now join in the Nerf battles with the big kids.

title: We love the Lego Space Shuttle!
text: Our 6yr old used his birthday money to order this, and he was SO excited when it arrived! It is a wonderful set, and not too challenging for our little guy. The set arrived on time, and just as pictured. True Lego quality; I'm sure it will be around our house for a long time!

title: Two Stars
text: Shrunk in seconds and very small

title: So cute
text: Really cute pop it bag. Small, about the size of a slice of bread, with zipper top and comes with carry strap you can use or not. Adjustable strap. Colors are bright and just an overall cute gift

title: Stupid fun for every age
text: Literally a squeeze ball that pukes and sucks it back up.  For no reason.  Why do I enjoy this so much?  No clue. But it's cute and funny and doesn't stain the furniture  Buy 10

title: Squishie pusheen surprise
text: Random pusheen, palm sized—and squishie!

title: Good kit for the money
text: Very good molecular building kit. Easy to remove and reattach. Explanation of what each one should symbolize as well. Only issue was having “double bonds” attach to knobs. The plastic didnt bend easily and double bonds couldn't be created, even with assistance from the manual. Just didnt have enough give on the plastic. Otherwise a good set to use for chemistry and biochem.

title: Good game
text: I didn't realize this was a travel Go game but it works. List of board pieces and strong magnets. Board can be floppy in the crease but goes away if it's in a sturdy surface.

title: Well worth the cost
text:
Great toy. Folds together to take along and snaps together to keep parts together. Things do roll around a lot so putting stuff in a small bag is a good idea. “Stage” doesn't fold in, so you have to pull that out. But overall awesome for haunt lovers. Has extra monsters that can be bought as well.
Takes a bit to put together but not terrible

title: Great collection of popular slimes
text: Great starter selection to make small quantities of different slimes.  Comes in a cute box all prewrapped with all you need to follow the recipes included.

title: Wonderful and entertaining water toy.
text: It was a gift for my grandson. He is one year. He and his siblings love it!

title: Lasted 2 months.
text: Maybe for a collector. Not for a kid/toddler. As you can see there's brown soft body but it goes half way down her arms so finding clothes for her is hard. It's hard to find sleeves long enough to hide that stuff. The hair I can't stand. It literally looks like a 2 year old chopped it. Pictures don't do it justice. I have a 1 year old daughter that loved this baby regardless of those things. Today the arm broke off. There is a plastic thin ring on the inside that the arm attaches to. The ring inside snapped in half. So it can not be reattached. Received 12/25 broken and unfixable by 2/23. I would not recommend.

title: Great price
text: My son really wanted one of these. Shipping was really fast, price was great and we've had 0 issues. I would recommend

title: Would definitely buy again!
text: These are the BEST. Way better then expected. Even I was excited freaking out discovering all the cute little erasers.  Perfect collection. Couldn't have a better variety.

title: Very Fun
text: This game was way better then I expected. The whole family got involved and the kids love it. Would recommend

title: Five Stars
text: Haha these are my favorite

title: Great chicken
text: Was a last minute gift, arrived in time.  Soft, colorful, the kid loved it.  Maybe a little pricey

title: Great little dolls
text: Got these little dolls to go with a doll house I made my granddaughter.  She loves them, within minutes she'd named them for family members

title: Durable. 10/10 recommend

title: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." Robert Frost
text:
While the Game of Life board game is a blast and fun to play, actual life is hell. It's full of things like taxes, and funerals, and funeral taxes.

I like how you have a choice to be educated but you start out in debt; that's some real life stuff there, Game of Life.

title: Doesn't even float for a child.
text: I cannot believe how terrible this item is. I inflated manually and it didn't work for me at all. I weigh close to 100 lbs. Tried it with my daughter who weighs under 40. Nope, wouldn't hold her either. I tried using an electric pump because I thought maybe I didn't do a good job of inflating manually. It still didn't work for anyone. Returning the item and never purchasing from swimways again. Honestly, you're better off buying pool noodles for a dollar and using those to stay afloat. It will do a way better job than this $15 piece of net.

Update: after not working for a while, now the light works. Okay, it's a phantom light

title: Cute and huggable
text:
This is a cute toy that comes in many different varieties, so pretty much no matter what animal your child likes, your an find one of these in that style. The batteries are easy to install and it is relatively bright (but not annoyingly so) when it is lit up. I do not believe that ours stays on for a full thirty minutes at a time, so that is really my only complaint. Otherwise, it is soft and huggable and will be cherished by whomever receives it. You can't feel the battery pack too badly, so it isn't hard for a child to cuddle with and the on/off function is on the paw, so it is easy to find.

The material this bear is made out of is very soft and it seemed to be well stitched and they eyes are well-attached. This is a great thing for a child seeking a bit of comfort at night if they don't like the dark. Overall, I'm happy with this product so far and hope that it continues to impress. I'd like to get some of the different styles that are available as gift this upcoming holiday season.

title: Great cups for kids
text: These cups are a great value for the money. They are a little smaller than I thought they might be, but otherwise, I'm really happy with them. They are sturdy and when the little ones drop them, they don't break. They are made of a flexible sort of plastic that holds up well to washing and the kind of abuse that young children inflict on dishes. The colours combination is good, so everyone knows which cup is theirs and the clean up is easy. I'd recommend these to other parents.

title: If you can't afford Legos
text: These are a great alternative. I can see no difference between them and actual Legos, except for the lack of the branding mark on them. The pieces work fine with all of our other Lego brand sets and they fit together nicely. I haven't found any misshapen pieces or any sharp edges. The colours look nice and the extra pieces are a good addition to make things a bit more fun. I've ordered two of these so far and both sets have been great. Recommended by a parent who has lots of experience with Lego sets and little boys.

title: This is a very loud, very bright toy
text:
I'm not sure there is a way to control the volume, at least I haven't seen that there is any indication of such a feature. The firetruck is rather low to the ground and doesn't work very well even on a low profile carpet, but works well enough on a hard floor.. it does tend to pick up bits of dirt and fluff from the corners of the room though, which will eventually require you to pick it up and clean it out. It's almost like a Roomba in this regard.

The lights on it are very bright and the headlights especially look really cool when the lights are off, but it is so loud that it gets rather annoying after a while, or at least I think so. Overall, it seems to be a pretty well-made toy for hard surfaces and it keeps the kids entertained for a bit, so I don't have too many complaints.

title: so easy and made the little boy happy
text:
This was so easy to put up, basically you just release it from the packaging and toss it on the floor and it is good to go. It is very cute and looks just like the photo. There is a little roll up door and holes in the top so you can see your little one through them. It is also easy to collapse and put away and can be used indoor or out.

This is a great option if you don't have a lot of space, because it can easily be put away and doesn't require a lot of effort. it also comes in various designs, so if you don't like one, there are others to choose from. I'm really happy with it and my son loves it.

title: Cute, sweet and still working even weeks after Christmas
text: So far so good with this little guy. He does everything he was supposed to do and is really cute. I wanted one when my son unwrapped him on Christmas morning. The batteries last for ages if you remember to turn the puppy off when not in use and he is a perfect little companion for a child that wants a pet without all the cost and responsibility. I am thrilled with this toy so far and so is my son. I'm happy we purchased this toy.

title: If you can get it out of the package it might be worth it.
text:
These are great. They are so cute and my boys just loved them at Christmas. However, that being said, I have never fought harder to free a toy from a package than I did with this. Once you have gotten through a yard or so of tape, then you will find cardboard inserts holding it in place. After that joy, if you are not bleeding from cutting off a finger in the process, then there will be little stretchy things you have to cut free in order to release the toy. I was not supposed to swear so much on Christmas day, I am certain.

Otherwise, the batteries seem to last for a good while in this toy, the dog looks and sounds like a dog and some of their antics are truly funny. If you are looking for a cute, mechanical toy for a birthday, holiday or general gift, this would be great for the little one that wants a pet. It also comes with an adoption certificate to fill in and some other extras.

title: Kind of a pain to put together at first but very cute and solid
text: This was a bit difficult to assemble at first and the directions aren't that useful, to be honest, but once it was together it was perfect for what I intended to use it for and it collapses easily enough and stores away when you don't want to use it. It looks very nice and is perfect for an 18 inch doll with a bit of room to spare. Overall I am happy with this purchase.

title: perfectly puuuurfect
text: I was searching amazon for a "big fat white kitty" according to my daughter's Christmas wish list and this one came up. We bought it and when it arrived we were thrilled. This cat is fluffy and very well made and looks just like it does in the picture. the cat was sealed in a vacuum bag to protect it and after a brief bit of squishing it to fluff it back up, it was perfect. I'm really pleased with the way it is made and how quickly it was shipped. This was exactly what we were hoping for.

title: great little kit
text: Bought this as a birthday gift for my son (age 12) and he loves it. The car is so cute when it is complete and there are three different things you can build out of this kit. It isn't a big kit, but it looks just like the picture and the parts are very well manufactured and snap together easily. Cute and fun and inexpensive makes me happy.

title: pop went the reindeer!
text: This reindeer is really cute, but didn't last for more than 24 hours with inside use only. After my son bounced on it for an hour or so, a tear appeared by the foot that we couldn't fix. I'm not sure if we just got a defective one or if they are all this way, but I wasn't thrilled with the quality. For a toy intended to be ridden on, I expected it to be tougher and able to withstand a bit more abuse.

title: He is so cute!
text: This is a well made stuffed toy with no loose seams or threads. The stitching is good and the giraffe looks exactly as it does in the picture. My young son loves it and it was a perfect gift. This is a toy that will hold up against abuse from even the toughest kid.

title: so cute and very durable
text: A very well made stuffed toy. The animal looks just like it does in the picture and was packaged well and shipped quickly. This was a present for my son who loves dinosaurs and it worked out great. No complaints. No loose threads or other issues and the eyes and horns are quite well attached. He loves it.

title: Good for young children
text: These are a great pack for young kids as the markers are small for a small fist to grab and there is a nice variety of colours for the kids to choose from. The caps are easy to remove and replace  and the markers have pretty durable tips so they do not smash flat with some abuse from the kids. I love crayola products for the classroom and for fun at home and these work great. I would recommend them to teachers and other parents.

title: It's not the best
text: This paradise horse is very cute when it is in the box. I thought it would be a great gift for my son since he is really into horses. I found after taking it out of the box that it is pretty cheaply made. The "pose-able" legs are ridiculous looking things that have little sweat band looking things over them so you can't see the mechanical workings. My son immediately wanted to sit on this thing which of course it is not intended for. If that happens, poor plastic horsey will no doubt have an immediate amputation. I wish this toy was heavier and better made. As it sits, it has only been a few days since the horse was made a member of our family, and his hair already looks ratted and tangled and he has a few trails on his body where the felt he is covered in has been damaged. Not really impressed.

title: Great toy for a great price
text: After having the chance to watch my kids with these things and experience everything they can do first hand, I was amazed that these toys are priced the way they are. There is so much for a child to do with these and they really look very much like a real laptop. The screen graphics are in color and although they are at times a bit pixelated and chunky, you can tell what you are looking at well enough. I love that they are loud enough for the child to hear even when there are distractions going on in the house. The other thing that is great about this machine is that, after the child gets used to a certain level and completes the activity, it re-calibrates to another level to make the activity more difficult. I think this is a wonderful product for kids that has the potential to teach them a lot of important skills for phonics, math and language arts. I would encourage anyone who is looking for a fun way for their child to learn new things to purchase this product. I am so glad I did!

Great buy for kids for camping or at home just for fun!

title: Bad Paper
text: I bought this because I love the other Crayola products (Color Wonder, Color Explosion), but this was a huge disappointment. The paper is so thin and it curls the entire time a child is trying to color. My daughter had the smudges from the markers all over her hands because she was trying to hold the paper down and color. Even when she finished coloring, I had to place the paper under something flat to keep it from curling. I feel that Crayola could really make this a better product by creating a thicker, more durable paper. Not worth the money, or the aggravation.

title: So easy to assemble!
text: Use this every day for a kiddo I watch. I can put it away on the weekends or when company comes over - takes up hardly any space when put away! Putting the tray on is NOT that hard!! Simply make sure the chair is pushed down (unfolded all the way) and push tray down on the chair while sliding it on. It's that easy. Friends of mine have the previous model and it works the exact same way. Don't let bad reviews stop you - this chair is awesome!

title: Genius to use!
text: These are a genius idea! Congratulations to whomever invented them! My five kids ages 3-12 respond well to them, making chore time less painful. The exercise ones are a fun twist. Thanks!

title: Does the job
text: I expected the paint job on these to be a little better, and that there wouldn't be as many duplicates. Oh, well. We have them away as favors at my sons sixth birthday party. They are bigger than I expected.

title: Not sticky
text: I like the pictures, but some of the decals are too small for my sons tiny hands, and they don't stay on the background. I wanted them to stick a little more.

title: Zelda Fans: You NEED this toy!
text:
This is a high-quality action figure. If you love The Legend of Zelda, and want to show your pride, buy this Link figure. You won't regret it. Here's why:

-He's fully poseable, and comes with 10 different hands that you can easily swap, 2 faces, and a slash swoosh sword attachment. You can put this guy in almost any pose you want. Even his toes move for cyrin' out loud!
-The sword goes in the sheath and the shield goes on his back. Or he can hold them in either hand. How cool is that??
-He comes with a stand, so you can get him to stay up in almost any position.
-This seller is awesome! They replaced a tiny part that I lost which was my own fault (some parts are extremely small so you need to handle it with care and make sure no kids are around. Keep the figure in a place where kids cannot reach or you WILL lose parts--guaranteed).

If you're a geek who loves Zelda, you still haven't grown up like me, and you still like toys ("No sir, I did not see you playing with your dolls again" --name that movie), then you need this Link toy. I keep it at my work desk and I get comments all the time about how cool it is. Totally worth the $30 I spent on it. And I'm a cheap-wad!

title: The kids love this!
text: These are great. My kids love playing with these in church. Keeps them busy and quiet. I only wish it was sold with a better travel pack or way to carry them with you. Otherwise, we love it!

title: Simple yet easy and fun game!
text: This game is awesome! My 3 older kids love it! My 8-year old is obsessed with it and always begging to play it. The package included all the parts and the game is very easy to learn and play. Even my 5-year-old girl is playing it and enjoying it.

title: Nice wood toy
text: This is a very well-made wooden toy. It has six shapes and six slots. And there are three different colors total. The wood is very smooth and finished perfectly. The drawers open up nice and smooth so you can access the wooden block inside. The handle is large enough for even a chubby little hand to use.

title: Super cute! 🦄🌈
text: This is an adorable terrarium. I think any child 10 and under would be really happy to receive this. It's very colorful And it's a unique hands-on gift.

title: Showing up for yourself!
text: This system works great if you are motivated to actually work it/do it. It's like a coach-in-a-box. The questions and prompts are self-reflective and can seriously unlock inside yourself. I feel that, collectively as a nation, we lost motivation in a lot of areas as we moved thru the pandemic. We questioned the path of our life and our happiness level. Now that we are on the other side, it's nice that “at home “ tools are being provided to help us heal and grow and succeed!

title: Fun for the littles
text: All of these children's kits are rather garish in color choices and cheap in formula but the kids love to use them. My 8yo was super excited to have a bag with her make up too. Real makeup! Not fake. This is apparently the most  important detail. The bag is cute and the zipper works smoothly. Overall, this little makeup kit has been a positive experience.

title: Did not capture my kids imagination 🌈
text: Colorful and initially compelling, this game lasted only 15 minutes before all my kids (aged 9-15) were not interested in it. We are SpongeBob NERDS so I thought they'd have fun with this like cards A.H.  No luck. So now it's just sitting collecting dust in the shelf. It's very well packaged and the concept is cool, just not engaging enough.

title: So much stuff!
text: For such a compact kit, this really has a lot of supplies tucked into it. It arrived organized and compact. Lots of different colors and shapes to choose from. Nice to travel with or give as a gift too. I would re order.

title: Fun; Very challenging!
text: Just the fact that I completed this puzzle and it left my husband stumped is enough to give it 5 stars. We love Rubik's cube and all the mind/pattern puzzles. This one has a different algorithm that took awhile to figure out. The pieces can get stuck if you try and force the turn when the puzzle isn't aligned. But when aligned, they move smoothly. Soft, pastel colors are a nice change too.

title: Daughter ❤️s it
text: My girl was thrilled to open this over-sized egg. It had several, colorful mini-figures inside that she played with for hours. She pointed out that all the pictures show this set came with a tiny ladder. Alas, there was no ladder in her set. (I took off a star for that) To further the tragedy, she left the entire set behind at the restaurant she brought it to. I believe she will recover. She just may have a mistrust of oversized eggs from now on.

title: So unique 🎲
text: My MTG and D&D centric son has enjoyed these dice. They are heavy, gothic and unlike anything I've seen. He keeps them in the gift box they come in. They fit snug and don't bash into each other. Upon rolling, they lay flat and the numbers are easy enough to read. These make a meaningful gift!

title: Heavy; adorable!
text: So cute in real life!! Vivid colors and quite a heft to it!! Comes in a thick, colorful gift box. The band is thick plastic and has plenty of sizing holes. Small enough for a smaller kiddo all the way to a larger, adult wrist. (My 9yo is wearing this and it totally fits her). There is an hour, minute and second hand.  The time is easy to change with a pop-out dial. Also, there is any extra knob that when pressed, lights up the watch face.

title: Cute set!
text: My little Disney Princess, who is 8, said this was a little too “baby” for her to use and she wanted real makeup. I suspect if you have a precocious little one, they may say the same. But honestly most younger kiddos are going to absolutely love this set. It has a purse and several different makeup compacts. It's pink and cheerful and the stuff dreams are made of. 🪄

title: Too confusing
text: It's just too much. My 12 year old got overwhelmed and I got totally lost. So, it's just sitting in the closet where it shall most likely stay until I want to torture myself again.

title: Always a hit with the kids!!
text: I get my boy something like this every year. He's always been into dinosaurs.  Each one of these figures is totally covered and requires concentration and time to uncover. Time I'm happy for him to spend vs being on an electronic device. Once uncovered, the little figure has some nice detail but basically goes into the bottomless pit of the toy basket!

title: Cool kits; need parental help
text: I gave this kit to my children ages 9-13. They all liked them and assembling them interested each of them. Each one required an adult to tweak the contraption at the end, which made us have a chance to talk about the lesson the kit was trying to get across. Did they learn anything? Who knows. After assembling, they messed around with these for a few more minutes and never picked them up again.

title: Fun for kids
text: This is perfect for 6-10 year olds. I asked a bunch of older kiddos if the topics/pages interested then and they were indifferent. The kids just a smidge younger all got really excited about the content. The layout is colorful, but easy to read and full of silly, fun facts.

title: Fun for kiddos
text: I got this for a 6 yo and they have enjoyed using it. The panda face is cute and the buttons are big and easy for tiny hands to use. This clearly isn't made to last for years. But it's a nice introduction to camaras and make little kids feel like a big kid because they get to control the photo taking.

title: This thing is so awesome!
text: What a fun piece to have in your living space. It's beautiful to look at because it's funky shape and real wood. You can't help but hop on and explore how to move your body on it. Instantly, you engage your core when you start moving and rocking. I love stretching my calf muscles out in this and practicing my balance, which is really important as we age. I feel like this is constructed really well. It has never so much as bent when I use it. It's stiff and several layers of hard wood. I'm super happy with it. Would make a cool gift too!!

title: What a fun gadget for kids.
text: This won't last forever, but my kiddo is so happy to use it and control their own film and pictures. Right out of the box it can be used. Easy interface, simple enough for a younger child. Bright and cheerful color too. The display screen tilts for easy viewing and the screen is big enough for small hands to manipulate.

title: Cool puzzle!!
text: This is a cool toy or gift for a logical, thoughtful person. The wood is smooth to the touch and the finish feels organic and homemade. The turning mechanisms are smooth and don't catch. Would be fun placed on a coffee table for nervous hands or a talking point.

title: Super cute.
text: Very soft and fluffy, cute and design was spot on to picture. Makes a great pillow or just something to hug!

title: So unique!
text: [[VIDEOID:3f0dc68f9e669ce3e1e1dc14db872974]] Such a clever and captivating design. We are dorks in my family and love flip books. I've purchased many make-your-own kits and the kiddos have enjoyed creating their personal designs. Never before have we thought to indent the tabs of the pages to get several different books in one. It's very unique! Each side has 3 tabs that provide 3 stories so you get 6 in all. The art is fantasy and futuristic. This would make a fun stocking stuffer or little add-on gift to the art lover in your life.

title: Super cute 🐸 frog!!
text: Cute stuffy. Very soft. All the stitching looks perfect. There are no loose parts in this. Every detail is embroidered. The frog is about a foot tall and 6 inches wide. He looks like he wants a hug!

title: So adorable!
text: I got this for my little sister as a gift and she loves it! Its super cuddly and cute. It makes a great pillow and even has an arm hole though it. Its very nice to sleep on its think enough for a little wear and tear. Overall a very cute product and I definitely recommend getting this as a gift or for yourself!

title: Daughter loves it! ❤️
text: My 14 yo wanted this and is THRILLED with how it looks. The red pieces interlock and are vibrant and cute. I think the chain is someone cheap looking but my daughter disagrees and said it sort of matches the style of the necklace. It hasn't irritated her neck at all, nor discolored it.

title: Fun extra touch in my game.
text: Really happy with this mat. Been using since Xmas and have only good things to say about it. It's flat and thick. But rolls to store easily. The bottom is rubber so it doesn't slip around. The pattern on it is pretty cool. Celtic-like designs. Wide and long enough for my arm span.

title: Messy but RAD!!!
text: Oh slime, how I love to hate thee. But, I caved and said yea to these because my 8yo loves unicorns. These 4 eggs had it all! The element of surprise, glitter, slimes of different colors and textures. Parents, make sure you are in the right frame of mind before doing these. Lay down newspaper or butcher paper because the sparkles can fly around and the slime will squish out of those little hands. These were super fun and all the kids at the party LOVED THEM!

title: Very cute.
text: My 8 yo is so happy with her new stuffy. It's remarkable soft and well-stitched together. The eyes are sewn on but they are very low profile so even if child sleeps on it, it shouldn't be uncomfortable. 12 inches long. The top is blue and the bottom is white.

title: Very cute.
text: My 8 yo is loving her new toy. The big eyes and colorful stripes are super cute. Both ears move and the eyes close when the straw fits into the bunny's mouth. The head swivels 180* and it sits totally flat. It's kept her attention for several days now.

title: Extremely poorly cut puzzle.
text:
I didn't feel like this was a well-made puzzle. If you look at my 2 pictures, you will see that basically there are only 3 different shapes that the puzzle uses. This means that almost every single piece is totally interchangeable and fits perfectly into the neighboring piece. It's ridiculous.
Absolutely can not recommend.

title: Very cute. Lots of choices!
text: I really liked this kit. My 8 yo daughter is indifferent to it. Maybe it's better for slightly older children. I thought all the bracelets were sturdy and the clasps all stayed shut. They are easy to bead. The beads were all like true little gems. Very colorful with a wide variety of patterns and colors. As a parent, I appreciated the metal storage box too. Nice to keep everything organized. I took a star off because the age on this suggested 8yo appropriate, but seems to me, maybe more 10 and 11 yo would appreciate it most.

title: Sturdy kit
text: My boys aren't into Halo but they still had a lot of fun putting this kit together. Comes with several small figures and then the main vehicle. My 11 and 12 yo did this easily with no assistance from me. They plan on painting the figures, if they don't lose them first! Over all a good kit. Pieces are sturdy and stay clicked together.

title: Fantastic kit and experience!
text: My kids loved putting this together and were able to do 100% of the build by themselves. They love legos and both commented on the sturdiness of this set and how extremely well thought out it was. The claws open, the mouth opens, the wings are super cool too! This may be one kit that never gets dissembled and gets to stay on their shelf to be admired. A lot of fun and we reminisced about Pokémon all night!

title: SUCH A COOL PROJECT!
text: This is a VERY COOL SCIENCE KIT! My 11 yo set this up without any help from me because the directions were so clearly explained. I did have to furnish the seeds though.
