I don't think China can ship seeds anymore after last Summer's seed scare. All his seeds have sprouted so the concepts of this kit make sense to him now. During set up, take care not to spill growing medium. It's not dirt, but can get everywhere. We set ours up on a tray so we could move the entire thing easily. I'm happy with the entire experience.

title: Very fun gift!!
text: WHAT A FUN EXPERIENCE! I gave this to my boy on Christmas. He immediately started “digging” after he unwrapped it. It took about an hour. He carefully unearthed everything then got to assemble the small skeleton. It was really fun to see him so focused. Everything you need is included. The dust isn't too bad and it cleaned up easily.

title: Retro and fun!
text: I can't get over how much fun the kids have had with this. It has over 400 games available, loaded on an SD card. You recharge the entire unit with a standard usb charger. The charge lasts a really long time. I don't let my kids use phones in the car, so this has been nice for them to stay entertained while driving. 2 players can easily play at the same time with this.

title: Fun for kids
text: Verrrry lightweight! My boy loves this and would give it 10 stars. But I feel like it's a bit challenging to have precise control in water. Best used in still water, like a pool. Say bye bye in a river! 2 battery packs mean you can charge 1 while using the other. But the battery loses charge in like, 10 minutes. My 12 year old is thrilled with his 🐊 gator!

title: Cute and fun for littles.
text: Not really a sewing machine. It's a felter. The package comes with pre made designs that encourage the child to stuff, then follow the lines with the felter to close together. This is for my 7 year old and she thinks it's really fun. I looked for extra kits, couldn't find any. But I can get felt easily so my daughter can keep creating.

title: Daughter like this.
text: I had one of these when I was little. I figured my daughter would have fun with it too. She's almost 8 and still enjoys playing with it. It's just like I remember but better because you can clip extra strands of hair in and there is much more sparkle.

title: Wish the plastic pieces were stronger.
text: The plastic pieces in this are a little weak. They don't support the structures outlined in the projects as well as they should. Which is why I gave 4 stars. As a result, the instructor needs to loom over kids to reinforce every step of the build. I wanted the kids to have more independence during the build.  The projects are laid out very well. You review the lesson and get the kids excited about the concept then the build reinforces the lesson. The plastic tote cleanly holds all the pieces and spiral workbook.

title: Cute wings.
text: This is a cute set of wings. The fabric is lightweight so it flutters nicely. It ties around the neck which may not be ok with some kiddos. The mask also ties and the eye holes are on the small side. The head band is so darn cute. It has curly-q antenna. My 7 yo wears this a lot and thrashes it. It's held up remarkably well.

title: Great craftsmanship
text: My daughter asked for this and I'm suprised at how well made it is. The bear is embroidered, the back zipper is hidden so it won't scratch you and the poly fill is so super squishy and soft. The velvet of the outside pillow is really soft too. All the stitching is perfect; no loose threads. Strange pillow, but well made!

title: Fun truck
text: Huge rc vehicle! The remote works fine and it allows for good control over the truck. This is being used outside too so I can't see lasting terribly long. But for the time being it is SUPER fun for my boy to play with.

title: Fingers crossed it doesn't break soon
text: I hope this thing lasts. Products like these are super fun for the kids but they end up breaking quickly. This one is going to be used outside. The boys love it. It really big, it's easy to unpack, set up and operate. If it craps out after 7 or 8 uses, I'll update review.

title: Fun for kiddos.
text: Little kids love anything teeny. This mug is filled with the smallest of surprises! Brightly colored and fun to unwrap. Got for my 7 year old.

title: Unique puzzle
text: What a fun puzzle. It's 500 pieces and circular in shape. Very colorful too. The back of each piece is stamped with a letter to help you out. The pieces interlocked as you'd expect. And it's pretty challenging.

title: So unique
text: What cool cards. They feel a little delicate when holding them and each one has an art nouveau look. The metallics really stand out next to the matte black. They are same size as a standard deck. The number is clearly stamped in the corner like a traditional deck too.

title: Cute bunny!
text: My 7 year old loves her new stuffed animal. It sits up on it's own and is sturdy. The outside is velvety soft. The eyes and nose are shiny plastic. She's given it quite a bit of love and it looks no worse for the wear.

title: Waste of time and money.
text: These always SEEM like a great toy but they only seem to provide about 20 minutes of attention from anybody my kids. My 8 year old and my 11 year old did 1 project each and lost interest. They said that the connections were really weak/flimsy. There was nothing to hold the gears at the connection site so they fell apart. I don't know if they'll play with this again.

title: Nice figures.
text: Great little figure for d&d. It ships flat, with both the base and flame cutouts clearly marked on the wood. After popping them out, insert flame into base. Super easy. They are sturdy, no tipping over. No splinters. And duh, it's not real fire.

title: Poorly designed.
text: Because this ladder only has 1 connecting point/strap at the top, instead of 2 connecting points/straps at the top, the bottom wobbles almost to the point that it's unusable. My 50lb child tried, my 70lb child tried and my 90lb child tried to climb to the top but the rungs fling out at such an angle that it makes it really hard. Poor design. Too bad since it's cute and colorful and very durable.

title: THESE ARE SUPER FUN FOR KIDDOS!
text: Oh man does my little boy like these!!! They are heavy and cling and clang in their carrying pouch. Super shiny and they do have an ancient look to them that kids love. 1 inch in diameter, both side have a different print.

title: Really fun!!
text: Super cute piggy bank. A little kitty paw comes up and SNATCHES your coin. Takes 2 AA batteries, which are not included. I remember with frightened glee, using 1 of these as a child. I hope my 7 yo likes it as much as I did.

title: Fun miniature for my daughter.
text: It seems like every little girl likes things in miniature form. This Polly Pockets micro set fits the bill to please! It's very colorful and comes with 2 polly figures and 2 llamas, none are bigger than a .50 cent piece. The hard plastic play house closes up and holds all the figures nice and tidy.

title: What a fantastic toy!
text: What a great climbing toy for kids to build core strength. Took less than 5 minutes to hang. The carabiner screws down over the clasp to lock in place. My 95lb son climbed all over this for hours and the hardware didn't even move. The foothold discs are very narrow. It requires child to engage core muscles to lift legs and place feet in correct position on disc to climb to next disc. Love the bright colors. Very very happy. Would totally reorder!

title: Very fun swing
text: We have been using this swing for 4 weeks. It's made our quarentine summer a little bit more tolerable. 2 bigger kids or 3 smaller ones can fit/lay down on it at once and still have room to flop around. It swings back and forth. It can be hung like a traditional swing with 2 straps. It's been in the hot Texas sun and the color has faded only slightly. Very easy to assemble. I would recommend to anyone with low tree branches and children.

title: Heavy duty YES!
text: What a fun zipline. All the parts are super heavy duty. Line hold up to 250 lbs and comes with easy to decipher directions. We are using 2 trees as bases.

title: My son is happy with this toy
text: I don't understand the concept of this toy at all. But, my 11 year old wanted this and uses it everyday. He liked the fact that the skateboard had a sandpaper feel to it. The rails come off, that's my biggest gripe. They get lost and thrown around.

title: 11 year old loves it.
text: My son loves this.  Fake leather but he doesn't care. The dragon clasp is RAD and journal closes with leather string. The cards are blank so you can fill in whatever you want.

title: Broke immediately
text: The hinge and the teeth broke the 1st day my son used this. Very very cheaply made. Looks super cool but not worth the money for a single day's use.

title: My kids love using these
text: The kids are thrilled with these. There's a massive quantity so they've found fun ways to use them; glueing to notebooks and using them as covers, cutting shapes out of them, and just scratching them off while doodling. The templates that come with them are cute, light and easy for little hands to use. There's many sticks, I think 6 come with set.

title: Fun kids' project
text: This was a cool science project for the kids. I made them research a bit about what a geode is and write a paragraph on it. Then, we cRaCkEd 'em open!! To our disappointment, every single one was white quartz. Some where stunning, some were meh. But the kiddos loves using a hammer and the anticipation of what treasure they'd find inside. There are only 2 stands and10 geodes altogether.

title: Really cool for tweens!!
text: What a fun toy for my 11 year old to assemble!! The directions were *just* challenging enough that he felt accomplished and easy enough that I didn't have to get involved. It all came together easily and the remote works fine. He's accidentally slammed it against the wall and it it still works!

title: Great gift for my son!
text: What a fun gift this was for my 10 year old to put together. It was challenging enough that he felt accomplished! And fun afterwards for him to play with. So far, it has not broken. It's been 2 weeks so far. Does not come with batteries!

title: Really cute gift
text: My 7 year old daughter was delighted with these. Each set of 3 ballons has 1 character and 2 toys in it.  They were easy for her little hands to hold and open. The kids love the element of suprise with these.

title: Well made, fun to solve
text: Really fun puzzle! It's actually easy to solve once you get the hang of it. (There is a cheat sheet included!) The wood is heavy and smooth to the touch. Looks pretty, almost like a piece of art,  on the coffee table and you just want to pick it up and solve it! This would be a special gift to a puzzle lover in your life.

title: Terrific puzzle!!
text:
This is a really cool, really durable and really unique puzzle. The two-toned wood cubes are sturdy and smooth. It has a nice heavy feel when holding and maneuvering. It's a tricky puzzle too! The entire cube unwinds in a snake like form. Geez!!
It's hard to put it back together!! However, a cheat sheet is included!!! Would make a beautiful gift for the puzzle lover in your life.

title: Super cute
text: This set is basically every young girls dream. Colorful, teeny tiny figures, as jewelry and lockets with a set to share with your bff. Really well done. My 7 year old was literally jumping with excitement when she opened this!

title: Ok
text: My 7 year loves this. I think it's cheap, plastic and unnecessary. She proves me otherwise. Shes slighty obsessed!

title: Cute little set of snap beads
text: These snap beads are so cute! My 7 year old can be captivated for hours putting these together to make jewelry. They are sized appropriately for little hands to manipulate confidently and unsnap with just a little more of a tug. You can make headbands, rings and necklaces. Everything is kept nice and tidy in a zippered pineapple pouch. This would .ake a really adorable gift too!

title: Extremely well made!!
text: Solid swing! We have been using this for about a month. It's been left out outside in the bitter Texas winter and shows no signs of cracking or splitting. The varnish is even. The heavy duty hardware is the real deal! I ended up ordering additional, longer straps to loop over my super tall tree branch. No assembly, and hanging it took less than 5 minutes.

title: Checkmate!!
text: My husband is the avid chess player in the family and has used these for 2 months now. He said these are excellent. They are weighted, so they are nice and heavy. They are standard sized, with some pieces slightly taller. The pieces show some intricate craftsmanship. Also, it's a bonus that the extra queens are included. He has enjoyed using these very much!

title: Bobby Fischer approved
text: This is a nice, simple plastic timer. Takes 1 battery and the on/off switch is on the bottom. The toggle button on top is easy to access and accurate. Nothing fancy, but the kids have definitely used it to improve their game.

title: ROLLER GIRL!!
text: S-A-T-U-R-D-A-Y. NIGHT! My daughter likes to dress her glitter girl in this outfit. The pants take a little patience but everything fits well and is interchangeable among glitter girls. Oh! And the wheels actually move. Awesome.

title: Still holding my daughter's attention after a week! Amazing!
text: This is my 7 y.o. daughter's 2nd Glitter Girl.  The 1st one held up so well, I said yes to little Ana here. She has become enamoured with braids lately and this doll came with 2 thick, tight, side braids. They have somehow managed to stay in after a week of hard play. The legs, body and arms of doll are soft plastic, but not hinged. However, she bends at waist and her legs, so she has no probs getting in and out of her sweet ride.

title: Daughter loves it though!!
text: My 7 y.o. is still totally thrilled with this car. However, the trunk stopped opening after 5 minutes of play. The doors only crack open about 1/2 inch and the glove box got stuck and won't open either. So, from a parent point of view, that kinda stinks. But my daughter's point of view is entirely different. She would give this 10 stars. The wheels work flawlessly and both her dolls fit inside. It's colorful and big so she can handle it easily.

title: Works perfectly
text: These work perfectly with MTG cards.

title: Very fun toy
text: These toys are AWESOME!! When the 2 pieces are separated, the lights turn off. When connected, the lights on the disc turn on. They have a magnetic connection so even the smallest of kiddos to manage to play with it.

title: Well made!
text: These dinos are really well done. Such amazing attention to detail. They are a little bigger than I expected which is great! My 10 year old dino-centric son was pretty excited to start playing with these. 1 of the dinosaurs can't stand up on his own so I took off 1 star for that.

title: An individual cube
text: This is a pretty cool concept. The top and bottom are flat,  the sides are warped. The cube does not work as smooth as a classic rubik's. But it's so unique looking!

title: Pretty cool little dragon kit
text: This is a more advance dragon figure for an older child. I ordered it for my 12 y.o. dragon-centric, Lego-minded son. There are several small pieces and you need to be in the mindset to start this or you could get frustrated easily. But everything is tucked away in a really cool, textured dragon egg and it's a fun project.

title: My son loves this!
text: My little future paleontologist loves his new dinosaur! When you yank the tail down, the neck swings up and it's jaws open. It's not the biggest dinosaur I've seen, but big enough that it feels special and *slightly* scary to my boy.

title: My boys really like this.
text:
Other than kinetic sand getting everywhere, this is a pretty good kit. It comes with 3 cups of bright green sand that mostly stays together, but my boys carry it around from room to room. It hasn't stained my countertops.
Really fun for my boys to use and explore.

title: Just ok.
text:
Meh. Just ok. Kids aged from 9-14 tried to play multiple times and were over it fast.
They did play other games, so this leads me to believe this game is slightly less engaging than others.

title: The kids liked it.
text: The kids set this up and played with it for about an hour yesterday. It's smaller than I had anticipated. About the size of a large dinner plate. The cups are nestled into disc quite snuggly and were hard for the kids to get out. It's a bit like the adult beer pong game tbh!! They all said it was fun. Not sure if it will hold attention for more than 3 or 4 uses.

title: The kids had so much fun with this!
text: I caved and finally got the kids slime. This kit has everything in it and they had fun setting up all the experiments. I didn't think it was too messy. Everything fit back into box when done.

title: What a GREAT STEM TOY!!
text: This is such a great way to reinforce basic physics to kids. My 11 year old is making rube goldberg experiments in his GT program right now. This is basically 12 rube goldberg experiments with a small workbook explaining the "why" behind it. Each "experiment" is wrapped in a  separate plastic bag. The gumballs are in a foil pouch. A great way to hold young minds captive in science while they have fun. Obviously the best part is it comes with massive amounts of real gumballs.

title: All little kids would love this toy!
text: Any little kid would be excited to get this dump truck as a toy! It's big enough for them to wheel around easily. It's durable enough that they could drop it or throw it and it would not break. The red buttons on the side are big enough for their tiny fingers to press. When pressed, the truck rumbles to a start, honks and beeps.

title: I finally caved and said yes to slime.
text: My kids flipped out over this slime kit! They thought all the choices, colors, sparkles were all so awesome! It was funny to hear them "negotiate" who wanted what. It's nice that everything came together in one box. Saves me schlepping down several aisles trying to put it all together.

title: Fun and easy. 1 design flaw!
text: My entire family has played this game several times now. It's really fun and the concept is super simple. My youngest is 6 and has only a tiny bit of a handicap while playing. She sits next to me so I can read her card or provide any needed help. The basic premise of game is, you have a time limit to name off items on playing cards you draw. If you successfully name off all the items on the playing card you draw, you keep that card. 1st player to have 10 cards wins. So for example, in the picture with my review is a card that says "braided items". You read that as someone slaps the timer (there is an urgent ticking sound coming from timer!!!) After naming 3 braided items, you use the spinner to see what you need to do next. You may land on a 2 or 3. In which case you need to list 2 or 3 more braided items. You might land on next card, in which case you select another card and try to name those items off before the buzzer beeps, or you might land on next player. Then, the whole thing starts over again. The only thing wrong with the game is that the on/off button is on the bottom of buzzer. So, it you spin and land on 'next player' you need to manually flip the buzzer over, and turn it off, then on again. That's a massive pain and when you're playing with 11 year olds,  everyone has grabby hands.

title: Very nice set!
text: This is a beautiful, sturdy set of figurines. This entire line is wonderful. All the animals all carefully done and realistic. They stand up to rough kid play and are pretty enough to be on a shelf and admired.

title: My daughter loves these.
text: My 6 year old daughter really likes these. She can't put them on herself and they make her hands really sweaty when she wears them too long. But once on, she really feels like she IS rainbow unicorn kitty. They aren't obnoxiously loud. Only 1 paw speaks. Both paws light up. I can't figure out how to access battery pack once included batteries die though.

title: Not as cute as other sets.
text: I'm a little dissapointed in this kitty set. This is by far the lamest Terra by Battat set I've see.  Usually the animals have such a gentle, realistic look to them. These kitties look like they had little too much catnip.

title: These stickers are reallllly big!
text: These stickers are massive! From the picture, they all looked like they were about the size of a quarter. Each one is over 2 inches, some bigger. I was a little disappointed in the variety. There were si e super cute ones, dont get me wrong, but why is there a water colored bouquet of flowers sticker?

title: Totally darling.
text: This is pretty much the perfect gift for a big hearted, compassionate kid. The little matted, softly colored furry ball has to be washed and brushed out before revealing what animal chose you. Very cute. And after getting your animal cleaned up, you can fill in the little adoption certificate that's included.

title: Cute but not very heavy.
text: I want this to work for awhile!!  I don't think it will. It's a little on the lightweight side. The detail is awesome. Just dont think this will last for over a year.

title: Outstanding!
text: This really is a beautiful and lifelike set of figures. When I opened the box, I actually exclaimed outloud "oh wow!" Because I think they are so well done. The set included 1 male and 1 female gorilla and 2 babies. One is being carried on the males back. He cannot stay up there on his daddy by himself though! Very well done!

title: WOW! THIS IS AN EPIC TOY!
text:
What an outstanding toy for a dinosaur lover! There is so much attention to detail and so many different components to this set! Front and center of course, is the 12" T-Rex. His legs and arms move. So does his mouth. He roars and his tongue and eyes light up. There is a lever on his tummy that opens and closes his mouth. Next, there is a 15" volcano/slide/prison!! With lava!!! AWESOME! The volcano comes with a big bolder ala Indiana Jones. Also looks like a small plastic "rope" ladder can hook on the back of volcano for ready escape! The prison has a battered door AND a "secret" exit made of massive dinosaur teeth and a "hidden" lever that raises them. Included also are 2 small dinos and a rather large egg. Lastly, there is a very brave, rugged 3" action figure wearing khakis and a hat. He drives a Jeep renegade (the wheels spin) which is ALSO included. Apparently he likes fire because he has a torch and a bonfire to keep those pesky dinosaurs at bay. Oh yes, he also has a teeny ax. I bet that's to chop all the wood he needs for his fires.
MY SON LOVES THIS SET! He's 10 and has been obsessed with dinosaurs since in utero.

title: Easy and clean way to make slime.
text: Gah! I finally caved and said yes to slime making! One of the reasons was because everything was basically in this kit and I didn't have to run all around the store getting individual components. Also, the "magic liquid" is premixed so there's no powder to spill anywhere. Basically, you add 1 bottle (2.3 oz) of "magic liquid" a teaspoon at a time to the entire bottle (5oz) of glue. But not just any glue will do! Glow in the dark glue!!! And it really does glow. The slime is the right consistency. Not too liquidy. There is no included container to store your slime in sadly. My colors were a pink and a yellow,  both with sparkles. I don't know if all the kits have those same colors. Everything is neatly and securely packed in the box. Also, Elmer's gives a website name for more slime recipes.

title: Only comes with 2 shopkins.
text: This idea is cute, I just wish this set came with more than 2 Shopkins, which is why 1 gave it 3 stars. It's a pretty decent grocery store set up. Inside the box are 5 different "aisles" with spaces for all your shopkins. There's an entry way arch and even a cash register. Not a starter kit. To really have fun with this, you will need to have a few shopkins in your collection already.

title: NO SLIME MAKING MATERIALS IN THIS, ONLY CONTAINERS, LIDS AND RECIPES
text: I caved and ordered this slime kit for my 10 y.o. I don't want to make slime in our house because of the mess and the endless quest for an appropriate container to store it in. This kit is really just a set of recipes to make 6 different types of slime, 3 containers to hold it in, and mixing tools. It DOES NOT CONTAIN ANY slime-making ingredients such as glue, glitter, baking soda. You have to buy that separately. And, no matter how good these kits get, there is still a mess to clean up.

title: Cute toy for little girls.
text: Barbie is once again trying to curl her hair! This is a pretty cute set. I plan on giving it to my 6.y.o. daughter. She's never seen a curling iron, but I bet she'll love Barbie's. This set comes with 3 rollers, 1 curling wand, 1 brush, 2 barrettes, a hand mirror, 3 elastic ponytail holders and a head band. Barbie is wearing a multicolored outfit and highheels which, alas, we all know will not stay on. You can curl her hair with the low-heat curling rod. Or with barrettes. This barbie won't stand on her own.

title: Massive set. May need adult help.
text: This set is amazing! It's over 1,200 pieces and includes several different sets of instruction books. My boys are10 and 11. Usually they can put these sets together without any help from me as long as they are in the right mindset. This one required a bit more mental fortitude and time from them. Like, 5 hours. Once done though, it's pretty rad. So, as long as you have the space, this Lego set is a much, much better a way for them to spend their time than looking at a tablet.

title: "Charming" and challenging!
text: What a wonderful, engaging, complicated Lego set! My kids love Harry Potter. They are 10, 11 and 12. This set is massive and requires whomever is putting it together to be quiet, organized and focused. So, you need to make sure you are in the mindset to be all those things or you will get frustrated. I did not give my kids any parental help with this. It took them a long time. Hey, they were off their tablets the whole time! It was truly "magical!"

title: Kids love this unicorn!
text: Slightly on the creepy side for adults to look at. The eyes are super weird as they open and close. The kids could care less though and just want to play. This is a colorful and interactive toy. Comes with a few unicorn veterinarian tools like a magic bandaid a furmo-meter and a sparkle-scope. You have to press on uni's nose to make her talk or, much to my dismay, whimper.

title: WHAT A CUTE TOY!!
text: This thing is both darling to look at and very fun for kids to do. It's on the smaller size, about 6 inches. There terrarium is enclosed in a thin plastic dome. The additional characters really make it possible for kids to personalize this!

title: WHAT AN AWESOME UNICORN!!
text: This is such a well made, oversized stuffed animal! It's literally every 6 year old girls dream! I looked over all the stitching, it all is really secure. The eyes are embroidered,  so no chance of them falling off or kids pulling them off.  The tail and mane are pink, purple  and blue with sparkles. This unicorn is big enough and filled w/ enough stuffing for your kid to sit on and lay on and not suffer the consequences! Comes with a heart-shaped ID tag.

title: The kids loved this!
text: Fun experiment for the kids to do. They were pretty excited to watch these crystals grow. Everything worked for us. The little included figurines are a cute touch and really personalize this kit.

title: Want to get your kids off their devices? Get this Lego set!
text: This Lego set is insanely good! My 2 boys have had so much fun putting this together. It's a very big kit. There are 7 assembly books all together. The bags are clearly marked, and everything is broken down step by step- easy enough for my 10 and 11 year old to complete without any parental help. The rocket launch pad has hinged, movable pieces that fall away when rocket takes off. The track holds a little car that easily moves. The launch office even has a narrow slot in it to fit a cell phone to use as a display for the "scientists" inside. This set, when assembled, seems sturdy enough to not have to use the "Kra-Gle" when done!!

title: Great Lego kit!
text: My 10 yo son was thoroughly engrossed with this Lego set! It took him the better part of an hour to assemble it. It has stickers and a Lego person. Nice attention to detail, the wheels rotate, there's even an exhaust! He is now interested in the other models. Cool! And he can now pronounce Porsche. Ha!!

title: These things are so wonderful for kids to use!
text: My 6 y.o. has had more fun with these snap beads than with any other singular toy this year. They are colorful,  all different shapes and sizes and super easy for her little hands to use. She's made long necklaces to small bracelets. Plus, there are tons of beads, so you get a really good value with this product. I feel like any child from about 4-8 would be pretty stoked about these beads.

title: Super cute! Fun for little kids.
text: My little 6 year old absolutely loves these things! They are fun to open and collect. They fit perfectly in her hatchimals carrying case too.

title: Not very exciting.
text: Yet another overrated and too expensive small plastic knickknack. Kids love the surprise though. But truthfully, these things get thrown away in a few hours. Kind of wasteful.

title: THE COOLEST BEAD SET!!
text: This is such a cool little bead set! So easy for little hands to use and create something unique and cute. The chunky, colorful beads all connect to form a chain. There are bracelet bands the beads can connect too to make a "charm bracelet" and ring bands that can accept 1 bead as a bauble.  Endless possibilities and hours of fun for little kids. Very very good job with this!

title: Big Hit with the boy!
text: Awesome toys as usual. My 10 year old dino-centric son was so excited to get these as a b'day present! The bucket o'dinos has been out and played with every single day for a week. Good sign of a good toy! They have held up really well. The colors are vibrant and there is small attention to detail I appreciate. Each pack has about 10 different kinds ofdinosaurs. Then multiples of them.

title: Great toy for kids...AND CATS!!
text: These bugs are pretty fun for my boys to play with. They are supersized and gross. They also move lightening fast!! Our cat goes absolutely crazy trying to catch them. There is an on/off switch on the bottom. They are made with pretty durable feeling rubber. Each bug comes with a playing card that has a really cruel "prank" on it. I'm not a fan of scaring people just for laughs. We threw the prank cards away. Also, the batteries were dead on one of my bugs upon arrival. I happened to have some 1.5v batteries and replaced them. Zooms just fine now, but still took off a star for those things.

title: Pretty cool advent concept
text: All kiddos seem to love advent calendars. The anticipation of what's behind all those little flaps is fun to witness. I wish this advent calendar had an actual hotwheels behind every flap-there are only 8. The other 16 are little knickknacks. My boy didn't really care, but I still took a star off for that because that is what every parent wants!

title: These held my boys' interest for a few days
text: Very durable toy set and initially fun for my boys to unpack and play with. They played with them a lot the 1st day. Now, they are just tossed in the toy box, forgotten. I say this not because this is a poor quality toy set, it's awesome!  Rather, because it is really expensive! It seems to me, it doesn't matter if you spend 10 or 50 dollars, the toy they want so bad just ends up at the bottom of the toy box.

title: BABY SHARK! DO DO DO DOOO DO DOOO
text:
My kids rated this 3 stars for a few reasons. This baby shark does not maneuver easily. His mouth is extremely difficult to move up and down freely. There is also no on/off switch so you are forced (Lord help us all) to listen to the baby shark song sing-over and over and over and over and... yes. Good times. Eventually, we took the battery pack out and now we just have a quiet puppet.
The cool thing about this puppet is that the song (when battery installed) automatically speeds up and slows down according to how fast you move your hand. The kids got a huge kick out of that. We did not need to install a battery, it was included. We just had to peel off a plastic tab to activate the song. The puppet is sewn extremely well. After hours of being tossed around and having my dog slobber on him once or twice, he's no worse for the wear. I also like his bright color.

title: Colorful and fun toy
text: All of these ritzy rollerz toys are super cute. My daughter seems to prefer them over all other toys right now. All the wheels move easily and you can change out the "hubcaps" as you like. Each litter critter has a hatchback that holds the hubcaps, so there's a lil junk in the trunk!

title: Not the best
text: These dolls can't stand up on their own. This drives my 6 y.o. crazy. As a result she doesn't play with them. These dolls look like they have questionable morals. I wouldn't ord were them again.

title: Worst directions ever for a toy like this. Epic Fail.
text: Such a lame app and  all around poor experience.  This little robot could have been so fun. There is literally no info on how to best use robot in box. We downloaded app to discover won't work on android.  So we tried iPhone and still  app sucks. Who thinks of these things? Made my kids so frustrated.  Please dont buy this toy!

title: Not high quality. Kids loved him anyway
text:
I would be super bummed if I paid a lot of money for this and it came the way it did to my house. After we unpacked it and played with it for less than 5 minutes, little Mr Penguin had a massive rip down his back seam. (I felt around in there btw. The thing that makes him solid and able to stand is a sturdy piece of styrofoam, almost like a pool noodle inside him) His fur, while soft, is a little sparse. See attached photos.
The kids could care less about any of this. I quickly sewed up penguin's back and the kids thought he was snuggly and cute and massive. He is a cool stuffed animal, to be sure. Just not the best quality.

title: Cute toy
text: Cute little toy set from Enchantimals. We have several of these sets, this one is the one my daughter plays with the least. It may be because the figure needs to be in a standing position to maximize playing with this, and the only way to accomplish this is by using a teensy peg on top of toy platforms and teensy hole on bottom of toy figure. You fit them together and figure stands up. It's hard for her little fingers to do. The colors are vibrant and fun and the mechanisms on toy work great. She likes this line of toys more than barbie, polly pockets etc. And they work well with her existing sets.

title: Such a cute toy!
text: Enchantimals has put out a super cute, fun toy. This snail opens up into a little sleeper/camper. The fridge opens, and the little doll included fits in the bed space, drivers seat and kitchen. Bright use of colors. The wheels really spin and the clasp opens and closes with out problems. My 6y.o. loves this line of toys. They've kept her imagination occupied for hours on end.

title: Not my daughter's favorite.
text: The dolls can't stand up on their own and the closet topples over when too many things hang in it. That frustrates my 6 y.o. so she refuses to play with these. It's a cool concept. But all the "clothes" look a little skanky in my opinion.

title: We love the Enchanimals line of toys!
text: Perfect for my 6 y.o. She played with set all weekend. The little easel set up easily and stayed up. The little doll is colorful with a painted face.Her bodice is painted on also. Her skirt is fabric and can slip off and on easy.  Her tail does not come off. The shoes don't fall off either, which I just found out is VERY important to a 6y.o. And she comes with a little fox critter. I like the Enchantimals line. We've gotten several toys from it and they have provided hours of fun.

title: Great concept. Cool hands on project
text: Colorful and well laid out book. My 12 y.o. went full charge into this project. Some of the concepts she discovered were too advanced for her. Of course there is a little mess involved too so you have to be in the frame if mind to #1) help a younger child with this and #2) clean up. Over all, pretty fun.

title: 6 y.o. loves this Polly Pocket set!
text: Polly does it again! My 6 y.o. was so excited to play with these! The set is colorful and massive and kept her intensely occupied alllll day. The clothes are easy for her tiny hands to get off and on. And there are lots of accessories to go on Polly. Polly's boyfriend is in this pack too. We call him Paul. Ha! He packed plenty of clothes to wear too. Overall, really well thought out variety of things in this pack.

title: Colorful toy has held my girl's imagination for a while now.
text: My 6y.o. likes anything miniature. This cute little ritzy rollerz bus made her very happy! She has played with it a lot over the course of the last 2 weeks. The toy opens into 3 parts and looks like a little travel bus inside. The drawers open and close, There is a rug to pull out, there are little sticker plates to decorate it, and the wheels roll easily. It also came with a smaller fox on wheels. The tail end opens up on that little guy too. You can store these little sticker plates in him. She's since collected 4 more little critters. I can see where this is going!

title: Really fun to play with
text: We all love this toy! It has proved to be pretty durable after heavy use. The boy's love the crunching noises it makes and how easy the remote is to use. Our little dog was pretty confused by it! We curl it up, then straighten it out in front of her and she barks and tries to bite it. One of the better r/c units we've played with.

title: What a weird and challenging game!!
text:
This is an excellent game for a certain type of kid. (My one son happens to be one, my other son, is not)
It can get pretty hard and it really is meant for 1 player.
There are 60 playing cards, each with a different color-match puzzle on the front, and the solution on back.
There are 6 colors of silly putty.
Each puzzle uses 2 balls of each color of putty.
After setting up the plastic playing board to exactly match the playing card, the object is to connect the colors (by stretching it) without touching any other color, pulling the putty around the maze. It sounds easy, but requires strategy and the ability to think ahead a few steps.
So, my chess player son really likes this
My YouTube son could care less about it.
Boys are 11 and 10, respectively.
It cleans up very well- it's not slimy. All the 6 colors fit into a designated slot inside board. (See attached pic) They have never dried out.
Great for a rainy day!

title: My boys like this set
text:
My 2 boys like these figurines. They could care less about the cards inside and the magnet discs (when the bakugan touches the magnet when dropped, it opens)
They like figuring out how to open and set them up and how to close the figures back to perfect round balls again. They did say this set has 2 really easy bakugan in it, which they said was LAME. Ha! So they asked me to rate it 4 stars. As a Mom, this is a very durable toy- as it's meant to be dropped. And I like the fact that there's no loose parts on bakugan balls.

title: 5 stars from 9 year old boy
text: This bakugan set was for my 9 y.o. son. He was super excited to play with these because they are so unique. He told me that of several packs he'd seen, this one had the best figures in it. Included in the set are 3 figurines, playing cards and some magnetic discs, about the size of a poker chip. If you touch the bakugans tummy to the magnet, they open. The theory being, if you drop the bakugan onto the disc perfectly, they open. They also open and close manually. On the actual creatures, there are no removable parts. They are a little like a cross between a transformer and a pokemon ball. He said he liked being able to fold them up again and again. And in his words "they're monsters, so like, there's that!

title: What a cool, hands-on way for kids to learn! We loved it!
text: This boombox was for my 10 y.o. son. He loved the entire process. It was a very hands on project for him and I was never involved in helping him decipher anything. (Bonus!!) He said the instructions came in a small book. The book was also filled with lots of other fun info about radio waves, different types of radios, funny radio history and 3 pages of games. He loved it!! It took him about 30 minutes to assemble. We all gathered around him ad he turned it on. Suddenly, music was playing in our house! We all cheered and had a fun afternoon listening to it. My son said that the wires connecting to the speakers can break off, so be a little gentle when using this part. This unit is not durable, it is made from thin cardboard, which is why I gave it only 4 stars. If you baby it, it might last 3 or 4 days. Ours broke already because, you know, 10 y.o. boy. Fun while it lasted, and worth the money and time. Very cool little kit.

title: Fun and appropriate for 10 y.o. and up
text:
My 10 year old put this together over the course of 2 day without a single second of help or encouragement from me. He said the instructions where clear and laid out easy to follow. He was very pleased with himself for completing his mission!
I would say, upon looking at his finished product, it is quite delicate and he really can't play with it, so it will most likely end up in the Lego box soon with his 1,000 other pieces.

title: These are beautiful little beasts!!
text: I actually gasped when I pulled these animals out of the box. They are beautiful. Bigger than I expected,  super sturdy and so much detail. The colors and textures really do a lot too to make these figures feel really special.

title: Warms my heart to watch my kiddos play this game
text: This game is for my 6y.o. little girl and I ask her older siblings play. They have all remarked that it's suprisingly fun and generally don't complain. Super easy to set up. It's nice that all the jewelry pieces are in ziploc-like bags that can be opened and closed as needed. -versus ripping open the plastic bags holding all your game pieces, then forever more, the tokens and dice slide all around the box, threatening to get lost. The game took about 20 minutes to play with 4 players. Everything folds up neatly after play and the box is not very big so it doesnt take up too much space on the game shelf!

title: 6 y.o. is super happy with this cute doll!!
text: My 6 year old daughter has not put this doll down. She was never very into Barbies so I was a little suprised by this. I think they've done a pretty good job making this doll fun. She's bigger (about 14") than a barbie. But not as massive as an American Girl doll. She's kind of soft and squishy. Not gross like a baby alive, but enough that there's some realness to her. Her clothes are bright and sparkly. Her slip-on gold shoes stay on her feet. (apparently important to a 6 y.o.) And her hair is brushable-staying smooth and shiny versus looking like she just stepped out into the humid bayou after being brushed. I'd say, if you have a girl from 4-8, she'd appreciate all the little extras this doll had to offer.

title: Broke right away.
text: Broke within the first hour if use. I would choose something different if you're considering these for an elementary aged boy.

title: Best lego kit I've purchased.
text:
Probably the best lego purchase I have ever made. The kids had an absolute blast assembling these. They are sturdy and interchangeable, the jaws and other joints move and they have fun little details in them. Very good price too.

These were for an 8 y.o. and 10 y.o. boy. But my 5 y.o. girl is enamored with them too.

title: Fun, sturdy puzzle!
text: We got this for my 10 year old at Christmas, but we all play it! It will drive you mad, but it's pretty fun. P.s.This thing can take a beating too. It's been dropped several times and has stayed completely intact.

title: Nice toy for kids
text: Bought as stocking stuffer for 11 yo girl. She and all the other kids still take this off the shelf and play with it almost 6 months later. And unlike so many toys my kids get, this one is not broken after they play with it consistently. Fun purchase and nice to have a non-electronic toy to help hand\eye coordination.

title: Better than expected.
text: Bought these for inside a pinata. Suprised at how much detail they have, how solid they are, and how much variety of dinos you get. Kids have been playing with them/trading them since party.

title: beyond happy.
text: I never write reviews for kid's toys. But, we got this today, and my children have been engaged, happy and quiet for 3 hours. I showed them once how to work each loom, and suddenly, they have 10 bracelets. The kit comes with a loom, a hook, bands and an additional thingamajig that can make bracelets akin to lanyards. So, my 5 year old can do these at the same time as my 8 yr old. The hook is sturdy, the loom is sturdy, the directions easy to follow. Very fun toy. And...I am accessorized beautifully now. ;)

title: Comically-Huge ball, about 5' in diameter, thick, tough material, will be a lot of fun
text:
Update: It's July & this giant ball was a huge hit at our pool party. It's so big that it is nearly impossible for one person to pick it up without getting under it. It's so heavy it mowed down chairs & tiki torches when it got knocked out of the pool. It spent a fair amount of time in the bushes with no punctures or leaks.

This ball is huge. It isn't quite 6', more like 5'. I would love to tell you that it is so much fun in the pool or at the beach but it's December & our beach plans are on hold because it's also 2020. We blew it up though & it's already a lot of fun due to its comically large size. It's so big that we couldn't get our arms around it so it might be tough to handle.
The ball is so huge that it took 20 minutes or so fill with an electric pump. I started to fill this ball in the house but the PVC smell was overwhelming so we moved it to my workshop where the smell is still overwhelming. I highly suggest inflating this outside.
The material it is made of is thick & seems tough & we dragged it through doorways & set it on the ground without worry. It has a 1" opening for filling or deflating & another 3/4" or so valve inside that which includes a check valve for final inflating. I used the 1" valve to fill it until it was nearly full, then the 3/4" to top it off. When it was time to put it away I used the 1" valve to deflate the ball & even to suck air out with the pump.

title: Great figure, faithful to the movie, not the stunt cycle from your childhood
text:
[[VIDEOID:3bd077e56d6c98a9858470ee43cf995]] This figure looks great, is very faithful to the movie & is very pose-able with 20 points of articulation. With the motorcycle it offers a lot of play-ability. The figure fits the bike very well & can be posed in many ways on the bike. There are several pegs on the bike that fit into holes in Duke's boots to make him at least look balanced. Duke's helmet doesn't come off.
The stunt cycle's performance is also faithful to the movie which is unfortunate. The launcher is more of a gimmick & isn't necessary to use the toy. All of the cycle's motivation comes from winding a spring inside the bike by rolling it backwards. It's actually hard to put the bike in the launcher after it is wound without releasing the stored energy.
The motorcycle isn't quite as detailed or faithful to the movie but it looks great & it can take a beating without breaking. The cycle also has an extendable stand & set of dolly wheels that allows it to emulate a wheel stand while either rolling or just posing.
I wasn't able to get this to any kids before the review but I think it will be fun as a standalone or addition to other Toy Story character dolls. I can't think of any other full size dolls from the franchise that come with a vehicle.

title: Historical, educational & an enjoyable build
text:
I have been bringing big LEGO sets home for the past few years for my daughter & me to work on in our spare time. It's kind of like doing a puzzle but with less frustration because instructions. It's also somewhat therapeutic for me to have a project that has instructions, an actual end & no due date.

We didn't know what or where Trafalgar Square is (or was) prior to receiving this set. There is a nice history lesson at the beginning of the instructions & it inspired us to do some more research & look at pictures to see how accurately the model portrays it.

This is our first Architecture set. It is smaller than the sets we have done in the past but it has many, many pieces & some very clever uses of the parts. Some of the pieces are captured rather than snapped together & parts are used just for their edges & unusual features to make steps & windows & such. Some of the assemblies are deliciously tedious & the result is a very good representation.

The parts & instructions are typical, high LEGO quality. The bags are numbered to match the build stages & the box is close-able & high quality. I definitely want to get more of these sets because of the historical interest, the build experience & the nice display piece that results. I do wish that the box was shaped so that it could hold the model or at least the footprint during the build, it wouldn't take much more space.

title: Large truck, excellent quality & detail, high play-ability, comes with 2 figures
text:
I got this fire engine kit for a 5 year old lover of both Legos & fire trucks. This kit was a little advanced for him so it took a little over an hour & generous help from his father to assemble.

The kit has excellent quality & detail, typical of Lego. The assembled truck is sturdy & comes with a bunch of accessories for great play-ability. It comes with two figures, one fire-fighter with a beard & a female figure who appears to be management of some type.

I am jealous of the kids who get these wonderful toys. These are so much cooler than the building sets I played with as a child.

title: Beautiful, detail-sculptured horses like the Schleich brand
text:
This 6 pack of ponies went to a 3 year old lover of all things horse. The toys are 4-6" long & around 4" tall. They aren't exactly to scale with each other but are about the same size. They vary in poses like galloping, trotting & standing. Their legs are positioned that they will all easily stand up and are relatively stable despite the long legs & high center of gravity. They arrived with their legs snapped into clear polycarbonate stands which helps preserve the leg positioning.

I don't know a lot about horses but these seem very realistic, beautifully sculpted & highly detailed. Their heft, sculpture & paint is on par with the expensive Schleich brand toy animals I used to buy when my daughter was younger.

title: Solid, beautiful as nice looking as the Schleich brand
text: Great looking, solid and heavy at least as good looking as the Schleich brand toys I used to get for my daughter. They were quite well packed. The detail is amazing, each of these animals looks fierce except maybe the gorilla who has a slightly melancholy expression and the mellow lion. They don't have a chemical smell like some of the molded pvc toys we get. They were presented to a 3 year old animal lover who is loving them.

title: Perfect for my project.
text: This should get another half star but these just don't quite have the quality feel of the name brand set.  That said, they worked perfectly for my project.  They cut fairly easily with a pair of shears.  The plates have holes in the corners (that I used) but honestly I think they add to the feel that these are different.

title: Groovy set, looks great, plays great.
text: Like Zoinks!  this is a far out set that hits all the high points.  The gang can keep on truckin in the faithfully depicted mystery machine that has a lot of playability.  Let'sl split up!, the Mystery Machine has a removable roof, an opening cargo area and some radio equipment so they can drop the hammer and chat with the girls if they have their ears on.  The Fred and Shaggy mini figs are groovy but Scooby is kind of a stiff, Rut Roh!  It also has some kind of funky tree-robot thing and a masked Zombie.

title: Born before 1980?  This is the set you are looking for.  The good news is you should be able to afford this premium version.
text: This is the game I grew up playing with the lollipop people and the and the slab cars and is the the version that I wanted to play with my daughter.  The nostalgia and fun we experience is almost enough to make me forget how much more expensive this game is than the newer versions.  Now that I am in my 40s and old enough to read the rules I also realize how much my older sister used to cheat.

title: Perfect Mouse-shaped Chewy
text: This arrived in perfect condition, the box had been discretely opened to identify the figure inside and re-sealed well.  I like these earlier Vinylmations because they are still shaped like Mickey.  My daughter thought he should have come with a bowcaster.

title: Sturdy, fun and creative
text: This was a big hit as a Christmas present for my 3 year old granddaughter. Lots of creative playtime.

title: Package arrived but box was already opened. Won't know ...
text: Package arrived but box was already opened. Won't know if it works until after Christmas as this is a present but with the box being opened already, makes me nervous and frustrated.

title: Nice gift
text: Liked all the choices

title: No no
text: Did not meet m standard. I thought it would be a little more durable, my twin grandson are all will have them  dis assemble fast.

title: Uncomplicated game
text:
loads of fun stacking the mice.
it's great to watch them stack the mice all the way up.

title: great building
text: Both grandsons love building anything. This brightly colored kit comes with instructions (easy to follow pictures) to build several projects. They'll have hours of fun playing with these.

title: hoping this game helps
text: Math isn't always fun and easy for everyone. I'm hoping this game helps. It has the same grid the teacher sent home on paper. It'a also the same grid I had to create back in the 5th grade. I know it will help with memorization, and hope it will be fun enough for all my grandchildren to play.

title: easy for small hands
text: Not sure we need so many balls,  but we can put them up as replacement balls. The size is perfect for small hands. The pump is easy for adults to use, but maybe a little difficult for 4 year olds. Colors are bright.

title: wooden toys are best
text: I ordered this because I thought I'd have fun playing it with them. I like the way it will help them to recognize words, and even create sentences with them. It's the kind of toy that is never the same twice.

title: I think this will be fun
text: This is perfect to teach my granddaughter the rudiments of sewing. It has good instructions and illustrations so she can get the hang of it quickly.

title: perfect stacking and rollong toy plus
text: the added value of learning the alphabet. My youngest grandson loves to stack blocks and to roll cars. This is the perfect combination. The best part is that it's a  STEM Montessori toys are designed to encourage kids' language skills, improve hands-on ability, fine motor skills, imagination, boost early brain development.

title: Cute put in/take out toy
text: My grandson loves to put things in and take things out. Plus he loves cars. This will be a particular favorite to play with. Also it has cars, truck, and a plane-- very diverse stretch for the imagination.

title: Helps lengthen attention span
text: Headlights, steam engine caution cone etc. Made foe active little minds. Definitely perfect for 2 year olds, and my 4-year-old grandson has fun playing with his younger brother. Just bear in mind you don't have to activate the steam thing and what isn't known isn't missed.

title: More fun than Go Fish or Old Maid
text: Putting a time limit on a matching game isn't all that unique, but this game makes it fun to race to get the card filled with matches. Great for kids from 3 to 8 years old. Even Grandma has fun with it.

title: A book
text: This would be great for taking on a trip. Broadens and stimulates creativity. Just a different type of drawing. Creative thinking because it's a black canvas and you are drawing negative rather than positive space..

title: Great for 1-2 grade school
text: It's a bit babyish for 3rd grade. But is just the right challenge for 1st and 2nd grades. Sturdy and I think it's a good value for the money.

title: So much fun
text: These things are a lot of fun to build stuff, even for grown-ups playing with grandchildren. Very good toy to promote creativity and use of imagination.

title: So nifty for girls
text: I love these. Easy to use, packaged color coordinated. Plenty of charms and beads to make necklaces and bracelets. The best thing is that the kit can be used as a fun activity at a b'day party where the girls make their own jewelry take home. Quality is very good.

title: a bit heavy
text: These are neat. They are a bit heavy, but that's good for traveling. The puzzles are colorful and interesting. Probably good for about 15 to 20 minutes of fun.

title: Great activities to keep little hands and minds busy
text: Paw patrol is a favorite so you can't go wrong with this activity center. It comes with a paper roll! Fabulous. lots of things to do and favorite characters can sit on the board magnetically while my grandson draws to his hearts content. He is so busy, this has enough for him to do to keep him busy for at least an hour. That's an achievement. It's sturdy enough and you can easily replace supplies so it should hand-me-down quite nicely from child to child. You'll get your money's worth out of this.

title: Lots of pieces and lots of engineering fun
text:
my daughter doesn't like it that there are so many pieces, but she loves it that father and son can have lots of building fun with so many different combinations for gadgets that move.

I like it that my grandson can learn some physics laws with this STEM product and that he can easily see how the fruits of his "labor" work. I can already see growth in his creative thinking skills, too. He's 3, but getting the hang of the gears and whatnot probably as well as any 4 year old.

title: very well made activity canter
text:
My 18-month old grand son can be quite rough with toys. This sturdy toy stands up to the roughest play. is giant, as tall as him. I like that it is made in such a way to encourage him to stand up and move around it to play with the different things.
he wqas an early walker and if he'd had this toy back then, he might have had better balance for easier walking. Love that my 3-year-old grandson can find as much enjoyment as my younger one.

title: can also build teamskills
text:
A nice change from Candyland or Shoots and Ladders. Colorful, easy instructions and fun for just 3 players (my 2 granddaughters and me).

However the game pieces are a bit flimsy. To move around the board you have a spinner rather than a roll of dice or drawing a card. It makes learning how to play very easy for young players, but can also cause a little confusion on what the needle falls on. Look at the pictures carefully to make sure your little ones are not too rough for the game pieces. What you see is what you get. In my opinion, the game is priced a little high.

title: perfect for any paw patrol fan
text: My 3-year-old grandson is enthralled.Paw Patrol is one of his favorite shows. He'll come running as soon as he hears the music. This will keep him busy for hours.

title: Just the right height, can live on the floor, too
text: This will keep my grandchildren entertained for hours. From 7 years to 18 mos. It is similar to other learning toys, but this one has 10 kids' songs, words and numbers and colors so it's cool for several ages. My older grandchild can teach the younger ones, too. It's a perfect play and learning activity.

title: Not too many pieces and everything included
text:
Probably one of the best toy choices for my 3 year old granson. He doesn't have a very long attention spay, but he loves to figure out how things work so this is perfect.

It doesn't take up much room. Easy to assemble, 3 stages for speed, and fun in figuring out how to jump the dragon's mouth. Runs on kid power, no batteries, no loud annoying noises, no flashing lights, just kids' imaginations and varoom. I love this toy LOL

title: Such an intriguing puzzle.
text: If you are looking for some for the person who has everything (and he/she loves to work puzzles) this is he perfect gift. i wasn't sure until I received it that it wouldn't be too easy or too hard. The difficulty is probably a 4 on a scale of 1 to 5. The box says it will take 11 hours to build. I figure it will take about 5 hours for my son-in-law. I can hardly wait to see the finished clock!

title: fantastic for little girls
text: Perfect gift for any girl who likes to write.The little decorating bits and pieces helps to personalize it to their taste. My granddaughter loves to write and draw pictures so this is the perfect birthday gift for her. Plus it is a great value for the money.

title: not all that sturdy..
text: I couldn't wait to see my grandson sitting up in this playing with his brother and sister...such fun to watch. It was great for about 20 min or so to watch them playing together--6,2, 5mos. My daughter groaned when she saw how many balls there were to pick up. Maybe i'll keep this at my house for when they visit. Then we don't have to worry how sturdy the thing is.

title: Creative juices flowing
text: My granddaughter fell in love with this. She immediately wanted to forget supper and start creating. There is truly no limit to the creations that can be dreamed up with this, or you can follow the designs already figured out. Hours of fun, no doubt

title: Lovely, just lovely
text: What a very nice set to spur the imagination of a little girl. Barbie isn't so buxom sexy as in other versions. This set is wonderful for the little girl that is into horses and such. It even has a little puppy. There are a lot of little pieces. So make sure your little girl picks them up off the floor 'cause it sure hurts to step on one.

title: Made a hit with granddaughter #3
text:
The birthday girl loves stickers! She went wild with these. Her mom loved that the stickers were reusable and she wouldn't be finding stickers on every cabinet door in her kitchen or on the fridge or on the bathroom wall. There are still several Disney stickers on the dining room table, not these, though.

I'm a "great Gigi!" LOL We did have fun with the stickers and making up stories as we put them on the scenes. Great fun for a 3 year old, 4 year old and grandma.

title: It's LeapFrog! What more could you want?
text: I am especially thrilled with this item because it will grow with my granddaughter and she can help my grandson coming up right behind her. It is a super teaching product that and something that isn't too large to take places too keep her occupied while adults are talking. She already has a Leap pad, this will work right along with it so she'll be more than ready for 1st grade.

title: Really quick delivery!
text: WOW! This was like next day delivery. Barbie has gone through some changes since my girls played with her some several years ago! However, this is a lovely set for little girls. Also there is a lot to learn about beekeeping. I'm delighted with it and can't wait to give it to my granddaughter for Christmas!

title: VERY small
text: These are like pocket dolls, the accessories are so tiny you can hardly see them. NOT for a 3-year-old or younger. Maybe for 6 and older. Not worth the money in my opinion.

title: Grandchildren's delight
text:
I have granddaughters that are sisters -- 2.5 years and 4 years old. They loved this! There is so much to do, and the kitchen/office fun was great for role play. The younger one kept baking me cakes, and the older one was busy "working" like Mommy.

This is sturdy and durable. I think they'll have fun with it for a long while. Kept them busy for ages and made my babysitting a lot of fun.

title: This is so cute! I got it for my ...
text: This is so cute! I got it for my grandson, and he is fascinated with it. In fact it stimulates him quite a bit. He can't stand yet and it's almost as big as he is at 7 months, but since it has 3 different difficulty levels, it will grow with him.

title: Granddaughter LOVED finding all the Dory stickers
text: Granddaughter LOVED finding all the Dory stickers. Kept her busy for a very long time for a three-year old. Nice activity for three and up.

title: Precious tea set
text: This is absolutely a precious little tea set for toddlers. My granddaughters and I have such a wonderful time at our tea parties. This is an added fun feature with the little extras included... and especially the tea pot that sings. I'm so glad I ordered it. It's a hit!

title: We had a wonderful tea party
text: Granddaughter loves this tea set. We had a wonderful tea party. Large enough cups/plates/teapot that her little 2-year old hands could easily manage serving me my "tea and scones". We had a great time.

title: Super for my 2-year-old granddaughter
text:
Super for my 2-year-old granddaughter!

I have watched my granddaughter play with this for hours. She loves cutting the cookies apart, icing them, putting them on the pan and scooping them off with the enclosed spatula. Of all the things she got for Christmas, she played with this the most. When I went back to see her a couple of weeks after Christmas, we had a tea party and the first thing she took out was her pan of cookies and then the tea cups and saucers. It is still a hit.

title: Wasn't a hit...
text:
It's okay... but wasn't a hit. I ordered this because my grandbabies were coming and I don't have a lot of toys for them to play with. They stopped and looked at it, figured out how to push the buttons to make it light up... but went back to doing other things. It didn't really interest the 2-year-olds. But my 6-month-old grandbaby LOVED it. She was fascinated by the lights, and the ears were just the right size for her little fists to grab onto. I think the age thing is a bit off. The toy isn't built for a 6-month-old to really enjoy playing if the baby can't sit up because there's nothing sturdy to hold on to. The older kids weren't intrigued because the music didn't last but about 30 seconds for some and maybe a minute for other songs. I was so very glad it had a volume control. Maybe there was just too much going on at the time.

I'm taking it to my daughter's house so maybe in a quieter environment the kids can enjoy it better. If there are better results, I'll come back a report on them.

title: Great toy for 1-year olds
text: Exactly as advertised. It should be great fun for my grandbaby for her birthday. I know she'll love playing with these.

title: Baby and ball make good music
text: My granddaughter fell in love with this before we got it out of the package. She dropped everything else and paid little attention to the rest of her birthday presents. It was a hit! Her mom likes that you can toss this into the washer. Great toy for a 1-year-old.

title: Everybody is happy!
text: My granddaughter absolutely loves this. She is 12 months old, and is really into music. She carries this around where ever she goes, stopping to dance every once in a while. I'm happy, her mother is happy, and the baby is happy. Can't beat that!

title: Great color pencil set!
text: This is a great color pencil set. My granddaughter will get a lot of use from it. The container will make it easy to grab for car activities and it will help keep the points from breaking. Great selection of colors and a great value for the pricem

title: Very good, but hard to pump.
text: My daughter got this to blow up balloons to make balloon animals. It is a very good pump and it works, but it is hard to pump air into the balloons. You have to try hard to make any air go into the balloons but it works if you try hard. Overall, it is a very good balloon pump.

title: Good, but incredibly hard to break.
text: It is a very good pinata, but it is extremely hard to break. 11 six year olds and 2 nine year olds were not bale to break it when they each had had THREE tries! We FINALLY broke a hole in it. Like, one piece of candy feel out. FIVE MINUTES LATER, a kid had knocked the pinata down OFF THE STRING, and it fell to the ground, but it wasn't broken. We beat the pinata with a baseball bat and it finally opened. So hard to break!

title: Falls apart extremely easily.
text: Do not buy! It is overall a good kids toy saxophone, but after two weeks it fell apart. The buttons started coming off and ripping. After a while we weren't able to put them back on. My 2 year old got it because his older sister was playing saxophone and he was jealous. He was very disappointed that it fell apart after only a little but of playing with it. Makes sense that it is so cheap.

title: Five Stars

title: Cute but flimsy
text: We got this for baby boy as he is obsessed with white and black contrast and hates car rides.  He loved the toy as it was very visually appealing, but we had a hard time keeping it attached to car seat as it is flimsy and he ripped it off really easily and seemed to lose interest in it once he was able to pull it down.

title: Little kids love this set
text: We love this little explorer outfit.  We bought this for my son's fifth birthday party.  Since we were unable to take him out due to the Quarantine we decided to do a dinosaur exploration in our front yard for him.  This vest and hat really made his dinosaur explorer outfit come together and he wore it all day running around the yard and it held up great!  I highly recommend this product.

title: Great Gift Idea
text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas, because she loves sharks and the ocean in general.  It was slightly smaller than I expected, but my daughter loves it and it fits perfectly in her backpack for school so that worked out nicely.  It has a texture that makes it feel more shark like and holds up really well to constant handling of a seven year old.  I highly reccomend this product for anyone looking for a shark stuffed animal.

title: Image was ripped off
text: I love the idea of this busy board to teach kids how to open latches and basic locks and work on their finger dexterity. You can also place photos behind the doors to make it more interesting for the toddler. This would even be a good toy for a parrot. The main issue I had was that it arrived damaged. The image was ripped off and this seems to have happened during production. They covered it up with a piece of paper (the paper label was not glued on in anyway; it was just placed on top of the damaged area) and sealed the product in plastic wrap. The plastic wrap was also not damaged so I know this didn't somehow occur during shipping.

title: Soft and perfect size for a toddler
text: This was super soft and plush and the face has a snout/muzzle that sticks out (ie is not just printed on). The size is a small stuffed animal that is perfect hugging diameter for a toddler!

title: Missing a part but overall okay product
text: The wheel works fine. The tab at the top doesn't make much sound. One of the pegs is missing a metal washer ring. You can easily unscrew the wheel to pack it up. Requires  screw drivers for full assembly when you first set it up.

title: Fun, sturdy, and easily assembled
text: This play structure is awesome! The directions were easy to understand and the pieces were labeled. It took me about an hour to put it together. It can be easily moved (for mowing or weather) and it very sturdy.

title: like the title states
text: This is not a 12 piece set, like the title states. There are 6 animals in the package. They are a large size and realistic looking. Happy with my order but feel like the title and description are misleading.

title: My niece loved it
text: My husband and I ordered it as a gift to our niece who just turned 8. She was confused at first why we sent her potatoes but when she figured out what this is she got excited and she was very happy with it.

title: Present For Granddaughter
text: My granddaughter is into these so I bought her first one for her birthday. She was thrilled beyond thrilled.

title: Adorable!
text: Bought these for my sons GF's little boy who loves Paw Patrol. My son said he will love them come Christmas.

title: Great Toy For The Imagination
text: Bought these for my granddaughters 4th birthday and she loved them. You can't go wrong with any of the Megabloks. I will be buying her more in the future.

title: Christmas Present
text: Bought this for my grown son to play with his buddies. They love the show and they love Monopoly so I figured it's a win-win gift!

title: Granddaughter Loved This!
text: My little granddaughter has learning disabilities so we stress educational toys more often than not. She loves this one and it is helping her a lot

title: Granddaughter loved it!
text: Bought this for our granddaughter for Christmas and she lovrs it. She has learning disabilities and this helps stimulate her brain.

title: Good Toddler Toy!
text: I bought this for my new little 16 month old granddaughter and she loved it according to my daughter in the next state over. She has a few issues and this will help her with dexterity. I recommend it.

title: Yes, compatible with THAT brand
text: Yes, while they can't say LEGO in the description, when they say compatible with major brands they are referring to that one. This is so much cheaper than any Lego set considering what you get for the money, however I can't say the quality is identical. You can tell these aren't the same but they are still very good. The included kit directions are a little bit difficult to build, but we all know the real fun comes from going off-script and building whatever your imagination tells you. For that, there are some pretty cool and unique pieces here that you won't find in any standard major brand set. I'd say for the price this is a great value.

title: Definitely deserving of the Hot Wheels brand!
text: I expect a classic when I see the brand Hot Wheels, and this is everything I wanted it to be! The car is surprisingly well made for the price, good material, metal parts and rubber wheels. It's bigger than a classic Hot Wheels so don't expect this to fit on a regular HW track (obviously), but it's actually pretty great as a scale model. And of course, you can pretend to crush regular sized Hot Wheels cars with it! Would definitely recommend this one. My 5 year old is a fan.

title: A classic underrated card game
text:
My mother in law loves to play Canasta with my daughter when she visits, but it's always a bit of a challenge honestly to find 2 complete decks of cards.
This set is great because it is set aside for JUST this game. They aren't regular cards, they have small additional print for scoring on the card which is something I didn't realize would be great until I saw it. It also prevents these decks from getting mixed in with our other cards and eventually have some missing. Canasta is fun but has a somewhat arbitrary scoring system- the print on this set makes it easier to follow and understand if you're a beginner. We like it because now there is an official "Canasta" set in the house set aside for just that game. Definitely a fan!

title: Now THIS is Monster Truck fun- Hot Wheels style!
text:
This is part of a series of Monster Truck sets that can be attached to each other or used individually like this, each with its own Monster sized car. I have to admit, I started with the firetruck themed "Five Star Alarm" set before this one, and I was very very disappointed. The stunt simply did not work, leaving my kids very disappointed. I didn't have high hopes for the rest of the series.
This set, however, is GREAT! The jump and smash is satisfying and fun, and all the things I expected a brand like Hot Wheels to be! I can't speak for the rest of the series because I only tried those two, but this is the clear winner of them! Thank you for renewing my faith in the brand!

title: Kind of disappointed, honestly.
text:
[[VIDEOID:ff549fe6468e1041353760916a879a3a]] I love Hot Wheels, they are a solid brand and I've had so many wonderful experiences with them over the years (both growing up and now with my kids). But this set doesn't live up to their brand name.
I actually came back to the listing to see if I was perhaps doing it wrong, hoping to find a video showing how it works. After all, it seems to have glowing reviews.
Interestingly, there's no video on the listing, and not a single user review video either. In fact, it seems like a lot of the positive feedback for this product comes from people who may not have ever opened and tried the product! Well, we tried it. And it doesn't work. While the monster truck is a cool addition to our toys, the set doesn't actually perform the stunt as described. Granted the instructions aren't good, but we tried multiple times and multiple ways. My kids got frustrated and gave up, I couldn't get it to work either. The fact that I can't even find a single video of it working is sort of telling. Maybe it's good as part of the interlocking set of all the monster truck stunts that they advertise, but on its own I have to say I'm disappointed.

title: Fun on and off track!
text:
[[VIDEOID:bba68e1290ac85ce5770809280bcd155]] What's better than a Hot Wheels 'vette? A motorized RC Hot Wheels 'vette!
This is still compatible with standard tracks, but now you can use some power to go up and around otherwise impossible bends and hills! The car comes with a tiny USB cable, so be careful not to loose that... the battery doesn't last that long, but that's understandable considering how much they've had to cram into this tiny vehicle and still comply with the standard size of one their scale model cars.
The best part? Taking this baby off road! You've got some pretty sweet stunt controls, my kids and I were having a blast making it spin and turn and drift on our floors- this is a solid toy and I would 100% recommend it!

title: Big bouncy dodge balls
text:
What's better than having a dodge ball chucked at you by your kid?
A dodge balls with a dinosaur face, that's what! This is a solid pair of fun standard dodge balls, complete with a pump and fun print on them. We threw them around the play room, they react exactly as dodge balls should. Down to to the echo sound they make when they bounce! Brings back memories of school yards. I can't wait for the summer to take these outside and play ball with the kids.

title: Really cute and inspires self play
text:
My son is big fan of Paw Patrol, we have a few other toys of theirs but never anything this elaborate!
